story:
My name is Scott Stone. In May of 2012 Doctors found Spinal Cord Damage from c5 to t5. I am in constant pain and most of my academic and professional pursuits have dissolved under the constant barrage of chronic suffering. I was studying Traditional Chinese Medicine with an eye on becoming a acupuncturist, but my physical limitations and recurring neuro-pathic tremors and ticks and twinges made that an impossibility. The only surcease from pain I enjoy is my constant long wanderings. Taking long walks doesn't eliminate the pain, but it does help me cope.

I have it better than some. I would love the chance to walk across the US for those who cannot. I can still walk, and I still have the passion and love for life and want to do this before I am unable to do so, in the name of all those who have lost the ability to explore and adventure in this beautiful country of ours.

I need help to put together a push cart ( I cannot possibly do this from a back pack) and to outfit a kit in preparation of traversing the ADT trail from the Pacific to the Atlantic oceans, and for food and various necessities on the road. I have sources this out and with second hand thrift I can do this, but I cannot do this alone. As you may imagine, I am unable o work and am currently battling the gov. for my benifits, but hold no hope in the system as it stands now.  If you cannot help me fulfill this dream, please pass this on to others who may.

story:
How it all began...

The Flipflopi Project was started by Ben, Dipesh and Ali Skanda. 

Ben and Dipesh are based in Kenya and the UK and their daytime jobs are in travel businesses that organize vacations to Africa for people from the US, UK and rest of the world. It was on a visit to Zanzibar that Ben saw the alarming amount of plastic - flipflops in particular - lining the beach, and as a direct response to that experience Ben, Dipesh and Ali started the Flipflopi project. 

There is clearly a huge lag between the scale of the ocean plastic problem and the level of awareness about it among everyday consumers in Africa and the developing world countries that surround the Indian Ocean. The FlipFlopi Project is committed to changing that.

An international problem

The 33 tonnes of plastic we found on our beach clean up in Lamu came from Thailand, Malaysia, India, China, Vietnam, Sri Lanka, Indonesia – and of course Kenya and its neighbors.  Similarly much of the plastic in the oceans around the United States and European countries will also have originated elsewhere.  So addressing the ocean plastic through campaigning and education locally and regionally where the impacts are greatest, will not create lasting change.  To do that requires a global story… a global PlasticRevolution.  

Sir David Attenborough, Sylvia Earle, Markus Eriksen and others have done so much to highlight the solutions to plastic pollution.  You’ve probably heard of these giants of marine conservation – we want to take their messages to audiences who haven’t.  People that don’t speak or read English, that don’t own a television, who may never have seen the sea. 

And with its simple messaging built around recycling the universally recognizable flipflop – an item of footwear worn by 3 billion people – The Flipflopi has the potential to do this.

Who we really are

Everything we have achieved so far is largely the result of volunteers lending their time and expertise to fulfil the projects goals.  Ali Skanda in Lamu has led the boat building, Nathalie Houben has supported us in Lamu, Shyam Radia in Nairobi, Leonard Schurg our Engineer, Benson Gitari and Sam Ngaruiya have provided the recycling and engineering know-how – whilst Dipesh Pabari has been invaluable in leveraging the project to spread the ‘world without single-use plastic’ message far and wide – we’ve been covered by media organisations from the Ukraine to the UK, and the US to Brazil.   

The final key ingredient has been the support of some wise heads in the form of our advisory board… Ali Kaka, John Blashford-Snell, Miruka, John Sibi-Okumu and Julie Church – have all helped us avoid some obvious banana skins, and capitalise on the opportunity. 

Supporters

Without some vocal supporters we’d not have been able to get the prototype to this point – big thanks are due to Kenya’s former Environment Minister Judi Wakhungu, all the Kenyan celebrities who took part in our talking heads film – and especially to friends who have so enthusiastically supported us via ad hoc donations in either time, money, or ideas.

What we need & what you get...

We need to raise US$250,000.  This will pay for the costs of collecting rubbish along miles and miles of beach line and converting it into materials that can be remolded into a giant boat, strong enough to withstand the heaving waves of the Indian Ocean on its epic journey south. 

Donations of no more than $10, $20 or $50.

We want at least 10,000 supporters for this, so we are limiting the amount you can invest to $10, $20 or $50 per person.  So aside from a small donation the most valuable thing you can do is get as many other people as possible to join you in the #plasticrevolution.

What you get…

Lets face it.. we all have too much ‘stuff’ we don’t really need. Formerly the preserve of just a few privileged societies, mass consumption is now a global habit, and it is obviously the underlying cause of the ocean plastic crisis. So we’re not going to send you anything.

It’s surprising this hasn’t been done before...

Given how inexpensive, durable and widely abundant plastic waste is, it's surprising that it hasn't been done before.  Plastic comes in seven commonly found types which are rarely sorted in the waste streams - the expense in 'sorting' it has probably put people off...until now that is.

 

Beach clean-ups organized with schools, tourism businesses, conservation organizations & community groups are collecting flip-flops all along the Kenyan coast. This, combined with the considerable media coverage we’ve received globally, is having immediate results in changing local attitudes to plastic. The potential for communities directly affected by plastic pollution cannot be underestimated and this will be a symbol of change and innovation for years to come.  We now want to replicate this recipe all the way down the coast of Africa.

Here is what we will achieve...

Waste plastics will be used to construct the entire boat: the keel, ribs and structural elements from 60 tonnes of recycled plastic products including bottles and (approximately 5 million) bags, and the hull and decking will be covered completely by 200,000 washed up flip-flops. Despite the unusual materials, the vessel is being constructed by local craftsmen using traditional methods. This means no power tools and no computers… just centuries old knowledge. 

We are turning trash into treasure - and in so doing, creating a powerful story for a global audience - to reduce, reuse and recycle.  Many communities who live along the African coast have very little idea of the long term effects of pollution, and again, this project will make a start on changing attitudes.

The Expedition: From Kenya to Cape Town…

Its not all talk…to prove that recycled plastic really is as strong as we say – we’re going to sail the sail the Flipflopi all the way to Cape Town in South Africa. A journey of 5,250 kilometers through some of the toughest sailing on earth – this expedition will be a world first for a sailing boat like ours, and will demonstrate to the world that recycled materials really are strong, reliable and valuable.

In detail..  

The journey will take between 3 and 4 months passing along the coasts of Tanzania, Mozambique and South Africa, where we will stop at towns and villages to spread the plasticrevolution message.  There will be openings for crew to join the expedition for 2 week stints – recruiting will open on our website once the boat is nearing completion – until then you can register for interest here.

Our biggest challenges will be the wind and the increasingly rough sea as we head south.  Traditionally lateen rigged vessels only ventured as far south as Beira (halfway down the coast of Mozambique) – because at this point the direction of the prevailing winds change. The following 3,000kms will be incredibly challenging sailing, culminating in a rounding of the treacherous Cape of Good Hope at the southern point of Africa, and arriving shortly thereafter into Cape Town.  Nevertheless, with some of the best sailors in the world on our decks and back up from an expert support team, we have every belief we can make this mission a success.

 

Its all about spreading the word.

If you can’t donate, you can still help by sharing The Flipflopi and its message with friends and family.  $10, $20 or $50 dollars from 5 or 10 friends will go an enormous way towards getting our boat afloat so that it can spread the #PlasticRevolution message further around the world.

By 2050, there will reportedly be as much plastic in the sea as there are fish - unless we all do something about it right now. Come with us and join the #PlasticRevolution.

story:
Located in Toronto, The Sharing Depot will be a community hub where members have access to a wide range of things without owning or storing them. The Sharing Depot will be the first of its kind in Canada and the largest of its kind in the world.

To start, The Sharing Depot will loan camping equipment, board games and sports equipment, house party supplies and even kids toys so that you can experience life without the price tag or the clutter. Rather than dropping hundreds of dollars at the shopping mall, you can now save your wallets and closets from buying and storing the things you use just a few times a year.

           

The Sharing Depot is our most ambitious project yet  and we need your help to make it a reality. 

BACKGROUND: At the Institute for a Resource-Based Economy (IRBE), the non-profit organization behind the Toronto Tool Library, we know what it takes to have a successful sharing project. In just 3 years we have opened 4 Tool Library locations in Toronto, we have thousands of members and we've loaned over 25,000 tools. We’ve been recognized at the Greenest Group in Toronto and our programs and events have received extensive media coverage.

THE SHARING DEPOT - INVENTORY: We’ve surveyed our members and done lots of research about what works in communities in Toronto and abroad to come up with a list of items we think will work best for a sharing project of this scale.

With the success of this campaign, we'll be ready to share the following items:

Camping Equipment: Includes tents, sleeping bags, dry bags, tarps, backpacks, coolers, flashlights/headlamps, camping stoves, cookware and more!

Sports Equipment:  Includes footballs, soccer balls, baseball equipment, frisbees, racquets, snowshoes, sleds and more!

House Party Supplies: Includes Karaoke machines, portable record players and speakers, fondue kits, bartending kits, lighting, punch bowls, a community music and DVD collection and more!

Gaming: Includes a wide range of board games, poker chips, video games & outdoor games. Think of your favorite games and their expansion packs in one spot!

Children’s Library: Includes toys, children’s games and portable equipment for 0-12 year olds. As they grow up, so can their toys with out clutter or waste!

The Sharing Depot will also be a hub for swapping events in the community. In December 2015 we held Toronto’s largest Gift Swap Event where over 3,000 gifts were exchanged in just 3 days.

The Sharing Depot will build on this success and offer a monthly swapping event for those wanting an alternative to consuming new products. The Depot will be your destination for discovering hidden gems without leaving your community. Swapping events will be themed each month and cover subjects like seasonal clothes, books and music, art, jewellery, games and more.

MORE TO COME...With your support, we can not only start sharing on a large scale, but also generate the kind of data needed to help others launch similar projects everywhere. Since opening the Tool Library in 2013, we have helped dozens of Tool Libraries get started in cities across Canada, U.S. and Europe. With the Sharing Depot we also hope to spread this knowledge far and wide.

         

By helping launch ‘The Sharing Depot’ you are helping start a Sharing Revolution that we hope will spread around the world. As a thank you, we’ve got some great prizes for you – check out the right hand side of this page for specific reward categories and find out more details below!

1) SAVVY SWAPPER, $25: Receive a 'Swapping Membership,' which includes free access to monthly swapping events for a year. Swapping events will be themed each month including swaps for clothing, art, toys, gifts, games and much more. 

2) COOLEST COLLABORATOR, $50: Receive a 'Casual Sharing" membership, which includes 3-4 day loans on all Sharing Depot items, plus additional fees for high maintenance items (approx $5-10). Valid for 1 year.

3) SUPER SHARER, $75: Receive a "Frequent Sharing" membership, which includes 7-day loans on all Sharing Depot items, plus additional fees for high maintenance items (approx $5-10). Valid for 1 year.

4) BRAVEST BORROWER, $100: Receive a "High-Five Sharing" membership, which includes 7-day loans on all items. NO ADDITIONAL FEES! Valid for 1 year.

REWARD: "MAKER FOR A DAY" $250: Build your own project, get a 1-to-1 session with one of our expert Makers. Your choice of woodworking, laser-cutting, 3D printing, upcycling or jewelry design. Get 4 hours mentoring & most of the materials you need to take your project home same-day (depending on item). PLUS receive a 'Frequent' membership from The Sharing Depot (total value of package $350).

REWARD: "PIRATE OF THE CARING BEING," $350: Choose from one of the following rewards:  1) One day sailing adventure for you and a guest in Toronto Harbour with our founders, 2) Get a live speech by our Executive Director or President, 3) Social Media Consultation Session with our digital team, PLUS MORE.


REWARD: 'LENDING LEGEND,' $1,000 and up - Get a lifetime membership to the Sharing Depot PLUS a High-Five Toronto Tool Library Membership (see below), PLUS your name on our Founder's Plaque, 6-month Makerspace Membership and Savvy Swapper Rewards.

BONUS: Tool Library Memberships - Some of the rewards offer membership to the Toronto Tool Library. Details for this membership are outlined above. Current members of the Tool Library will have additional years added to the end of the current membership plans.

BONUS: Makerspace Memberships - Some of our rewards offer membership to our Makerspace at 1803 Danforth Avenue. These memberships are valued at $100/month and offer 24/7 access to our Woodshop, Laser Cutter and 3D Printers as well as free certification workshops on these tools and a High-Five Tool Library membership. For more information please visit here.

Have more questions about our perks? Check out the FAQ at the bottom of this page or contact us at contact@sharingdepot.org

This campaign is all-or-nothing. That means if we don't reach our goal, we cannot launch the Sharing Depot. By making a contribution today, we can open our doors in Spring 2016 with a healthy stock of items you can borrow with a membership. Here’s a chart showing the breakdown of the funds we need:

                 

While we strongly believe projects like this are necessary for a sustainable future, we don’t have the funds or the desire to take this on without your support. If you believe in this concept, this is your opportunity to vote "yes" to sharing, vote "yes" to sustainable communities and vote "yes" to an abundant and accessible future for all. Any donations you make will help make the Sharing Depot happen, so grab a membership today and please help spread the word via email and social media.

We have an core team of 8 dedicated individuals who have helped create the success of the Toronto Tool Library and now want to expand with the Sharing Depot. We are a team of innovators, activists, journalists, social media strategists and  skilled-trades people – all motivated to make a difference in the city.

Plus, we have an incredible community with the Toronto Tool Library - with dozens of volunteers, over 2,000+ members and nearly 10,000  fans online. Whether you are already apart of this community or you are new, we can create a new era of sharing together with the next phase of The Sharing Depot. Thank you!

We are looking for "Sharing Ambassadors" to help us launch the Sharing Depot. Will you accept the Sharing Challenge?

Sharing Ambassadors: We're looking for people who can volunteer their time, not their money (thought it's always appreciated)! We need volunteers to help our team fundraise and reach the campaign goal of $30,000 in the next 30 days. By reaching out to your personal networks and contacts, helping us flyer at locations and talking to members at the Tool Library during your volunteer hours - you can help us expand the Tool Library into a new era of Sharing. We'll supply you with the resources and tools to fundraise and as a special thanks, we've got rewards to give you for your time helping us. Interested? Email Contact@IRBE.org with subject line "Sharing Ambassador"


              

The Sharing Economy that we hear about in the media is almost always focused on Uber, Airbnb or some other company that connects people to stuff through an app. While the Internet and apps are an indispensable part of the present and future of sharing, time and again P2P (peer-to-peer) apps have struggled to connect people to stuff with a value under $500. Furthermore, physical spaces offer a chance for people to connect with like-minded members of their community. That’s why we think the future of sharing will be a mix of physical spaces and online P2P connections.

Toronto Tool Library: Since opening in 2013, the Toronto Tool Library has opened 4 locations and loaned over 25,000 tools to our members. The Tool Library works like a regular library and loans a wide range of hand, power and gardening tools so members don't have to own and store these items themselves. In 2015, we opened the first Tool Library housed within a public library in Canada so books and tools could be borrowed under the same roof.

To learn more, watch our videos:

Community Nights: Beyond sharing tools, we also share a community workshop with woodworking tools, laser-cutting and 3D printing all available on site. Members pay a monthly fee to access the space 24/7 and we offer free weekly community nights for the public to take on projects and repairs with our experienced supervisors available to help out.


Inventory: Our inventory consists of over 5,000 hand, power and gardening tools, 99% of which were donated by Torontonians who no longer needed them. These tools have been used for building projects, renovations and gardening, improving people’s homes and lives in Toronto. By sharing instead of buying, we have saved our members over $1 million and reduced our collective environmental impact as fewer tools were needed to be manufactured, shipped, packaged and landfilled.

The Sharing Depot is the next stage in the evolution of 21st century sharing.

A membership will not only give access to these items, but will allow your home to be free of clutter, a leading cause of stress.

While this first project will largely be a real-life experiment, if our memberships meet our targets we anticipate opening more locations across the city and helping others start their own projects abroad. Ultimately we envision Sharing Depots will fill large warehouses (picture Costco) with thousands of items from musical instruments to audio/video equipment for short-term loans at a price that is accessible to all. These larger stores would have their own repair teams that will focus on extending the life of all of our items. Eventually we hope to make partnerships with quality manufacturers who design products specifically for sharing with durability and repair features designed into their products. 


  

The Sharing Depot is a vision for how the future of city living can be. That being said, sharing items is a challenge to both the way our culture has manufactured items and consumed them for the past century. With respect to consumption, the 20th century was largely about mining, manufacturing and waste with almost no thought given to the finite nature of our planet’s resources or where products ended up after their useful life ended.

In the 21st century we must change that. Rather than mining virgin raw materials, we must mine the enormous assets that we have lying around our own homes and cities. Rather than manufacturing, we must focus on re-manufacturing, taking the best of these resources and repurposing them into durable and more efficient products that are built to last. In the 21st century, we want waste to no longer be something that we have to deal with - it should be designed out of the system altogether.

This transition can’t happen without you and that’s why we need your support. Big problems don’t just require big players like governments and multi-national corporations. They also require grassroots organizations and community groups that are on the ground, changing the culture of consumption and access and providing alternatives. These grassroots projects are only as successful as the communities that support them and that’s why crowdfunding campaigns like this one are a necessary part of this transition.





   

This project sounds amazing, where will you be located?

We will have our first Sharing Depot near one of our current locations in Toronto. Depending on how much money we raise, we will open the Sharing Depot either near our East York location or our Parkdale location.


What happens if you don’t raise the $30,000?

This campaign is an all-or-nothing campaign so if we don’t raise at least $30,000, we won’t open the Sharing Depot. The reason we chose to have this kind of campaign is because as a non-profit organization, we can’t afford to launch this new venture without this minimum amount of money. Rent, inventory and managing this kind of operation simply isn’t possible for our team without at least this minimal fundraising goal.


The second reason is we don’t even want to open the Sharing Depot without the support of people who will actually use the service. We have learned that good ideas are one thing, but good ideas that people actually choose to invest in are often something different. With this campaign, we hope you will choose to purchase a membership, use the service and spread the word so the Sharing Depot can help shift our culture of consumerism away from ownership and waste.


What happens if you raise more than $30,000?

Every dollar over $30,000 can make a huge difference in terms of the quality and location of the Sharing Depot. The more we raise, the bigger and better our space can be as a significant portion of these funds will go towards paying rent in Toronto. With your support, we will rent the best place we can possibly afford that allows for accessibility and population density to ensure we have the largest impact we can.


Is the Sharing Depot and the Tool Library the same thing?

No. The Toronto Tool Library has four locations and has a separate membership model than the Sharing Depot will have. To start, we will have both enterprises in the same new location however memberships will be sold separately or a discount of 10% will apply to a combined membership.


I have lots of items to donate - how can I do this?

Amazing! We rely on donations to help us make more items available to our members. To donate lightly used or new items that you think will fit with our Sharing Depot please email us at contact@irbe.org or simply stop by one of our Tool Library locations during our opening hours to drop them off.


I want to volunteer with this project, what opportunities are available?

Currently we are looking for librarians who will help with checkins/checkouts, inventorying items  and enjoy interacting with our members. We are also looking for help with website development, marketing and outreach, app development and sponsorships. If you would like to help out with these or any other areas you think would benefit our projects please email Ryan at ryan@irbe.org.

thousands of members and we've loaned over 25,000 tools. We’ve been 
recognized at the Greenest Group in Toronto and our programs and events have received extensive media coverage.THE SHARING DEPOT - INVENTORY: We’ve surveyed our members and done lots of research about what works in communities in Toronto and abroad to come up with a list of items we think will work best for a sharing project of this scale. With the success of this campaign, we'll be ready to share the following items: Camping Equipment: Includes tents, sleeping bags, dry bags, tarps, backpacks, coolers, flashlights/headlamps, camping stoves, cookware and more!Sports Equipment:  Includes footballs, soccer balls, baseball equipment, frisbees, racquets, snowshoes, sleds and more!House Party Supplies: Includes Karaoke machines, portable 
record players and speakers, fondue kits, bartending kits, lighting, 
punch bowls, a community music and DVD collection and more!Gaming:
 Includes a wide range of board games, poker chips, video games & 
outdoor games. Think of your favorite games and their expansion packs in
 one spot! Children’s Library: Includes toys, children’s games and portable equipment for 0-12 year olds. As they grow up, so can their toys with out clutter or waste! The Sharing Depot will also be a hub for swapping events in the community. In December 2015 we held Toronto’s largest Gift Swap Event where over 3,000 gifts were exchanged in just 3 days. 



The
 Sharing Depot will build on this success and offer a monthly swapping 
event for those wanting an alternative to consuming new products. The 
Depot will be your destination for discovering hidden gems without 
leaving your community. Swapping events will be themed each month and 
cover subjects like seasonal clothes, books and music, art, jewellery, 
games and more. 

MORE TO COME...With
 your support, we can not only start sharing on a large scale, but also 
generate the kind of data needed to help others launch similar projects 
everywhere. Since opening the Tool Library in 2013, we have helped dozens of Tool Libraries get started in cities across Canada, U.S. and Europe.
 With the Sharing Depot we also hope to 
spread this knowledge far and wide.
          By helping launch ‘The Sharing Depot’ you are helping start a Sharing Revolution that we hope will spread around the world. As a thank you, we’ve got some great prizes for you – check out the right hand side of this page for specific reward categories and find out more details below!

1) SAVVY SWAPPER, $25: Receive a 'Swapping Membership,' which includes free access to monthly swapping events for a year. Swapping events will be themed each month including swaps for clothing, art, toys, gifts, games and much more.  

2) COOLEST COLLABORATOR, $50: Receive a 'Casual Sharing" membership, which includes 3-4 day loans on all Sharing Depot items, plus additional fees for high maintenance items (approx $5-10). Valid for 1 year. 
3) SUPER SHARER, $75: Receive a "Frequent Sharing" membership, which includes 7-day loans on all Sharing Depot items, plus additional fees for high maintenance items (approx $5-10). Valid for 1 year. 
4) BRAVEST BORROWER, $100: Receive a "High-Five Sharing" membership, which includes 7-day loans on all items. NO ADDITIONAL FEES! Valid for 1 year. 


REWARD: "MAKER FOR A DAY" $250: Build your own project, get a 1-to-1 session with one of our expert Makers. 
Your choice of  woodworking, laser-cutting, 3D printing, upcycling or 
jewelry design.  Get 4 hours mentoring & most of the materials you 
need to take your project home same-day (depending on item). PLUS receive a 'Frequent' membership from The Sharing Depot (total value of package $350).



REWARD: "PIRATE OF THE CARING BEING," $350: Choose from one of the following rewards:  1) One day sailing adventure for you and a guest in Toronto Harbour with our founders, 2) Get a live speech by our Executive Director or President, 3) Social Media Consultation Session with our digital team, PLUS MORE. 


REWARD: 'LENDING LEGEND,' $1,000 and up - Get a lifetime membership to the Sharing Depot PLUS a High-Five Toronto Tool 
Library Membership (see below), PLUS your name on our Founder's Plaque, 6-month 
Makerspace Membership and Savvy Swapper Rewards. 




BONUS: Tool Library Memberships - Some of the rewards offer 
membership to the Toronto Tool Library. Details for this membership are 
outlined above. Current members of the Tool Library will have additional
 years added to the end of the current membership plans. 


BONUS: Makerspace Memberships - Some of our rewards offer 
membership to our Makerspace at 1803 Danforth Avenue. These memberships 
are valued at $100/month and offer 24/7 access to our Woodshop, Laser 
Cutter and 3D Printers as well as free certification workshops on these 
tools and a High-Five Tool Library membership. For more information please visit here.Have more questions about our perks? Check out the FAQ at the bottom of this page or contact us at contact@sharingdepot.org



This campaign is all-or-nothing. That means if we don't reach our goal, we cannot launch the Sharing Depot. By making a contribution today, we can open our doors in Spring 2016 with a healthy stock of items you can borrow with a membership. Here’s a chart showing the breakdown of the funds we need:
                  
While we strongly believe projects like this are necessary for a sustainable future, we don’t have the funds or the desire to take this on without your support. If you believe in this concept, this is your opportunity to vote "yes" to sharing, vote "yes" to sustainable communities and vote "yes" to an abundant and accessible future for all. Any donations you make will help make the Sharing Depot happen, so grab a membership today and please help spread the word via email and social media. 
We have an core team of 8 dedicated individuals who have helped create the success of the Toronto Tool Library and now want to expand with the Sharing Depot. We are a team of innovators, activists, journalists, social media strategists and  
skilled-trades people – all motivated to make a difference in the city.
Plus, we have an incredible community with the Toronto Tool Library - with dozens of volunteers, over 2,000+ members and nearly 10,000  fans online. Whether you are already apart of this community or you are new, we can create a new era of sharing together with the next phase of The Sharing Depot. Thank you! 


We are looking for "Sharing Ambassadors" to help us launch the Sharing Depot. Will you accept the Sharing Challenge? Sharing Ambassadors: We're
 looking for people who can volunteer their time, not their money 
(thought it's always appreciated)! We need volunteers to help our team fundraise
 and reach the campaign goal of $30,000 in the next 30 days. By reaching out to
 your personal networks and contacts, helping us flyer at locations and 
talking to members at the Tool Library during your volunteer hours - you
 can help us expand the Tool Library into a new era of Sharing.  We'll 
supply you with the resources and tools to fundraise and as a 
special thanks, we've got rewards to give you for your time helping us. Interested? Email Contact@IRBE.org with subject line "Sharing Ambassador" 

              
The Sharing Economy that we hear about in the media is almost always focused on Uber, Airbnb or some other company that connects people to stuff through an app. While the Internet and apps are an indispensable part of the present and future of sharing, time and again P2P (peer-to-peer) apps have struggled to connect people to stuff with a value under $500. Furthermore, physical spaces offer a chance for people to connect with like-minded members of their community. That’s why we think the future of sharing will be a mix of physical spaces and online P2P connections.
Toronto Tool Library: Since opening in 2013, the Toronto Tool Library has opened 4 locations and loaned over 25,000 tools to our members. The Tool Library works like a regular library and loans a wide range of hand, power and gardening tools so members don't have to own and store these items themselves. In 2015, we opened the first Tool Library housed within a public library in Canada so books and tools could be borrowed under the same roof. 

To learn more, watch our videos: 



Community Nights: Beyond sharing tools, we also share a community workshop with 
woodworking tools, laser-cutting and 3D printing all available on site. 
Members pay a monthly fee to access the space 24/7 and we offer free 
weekly community nights for the public to take on projects and repairs 
with our experienced supervisors available to help out.


Inventory: Our inventory consists of over 5,000 hand, power and gardening tools,
 99% of which were donated by Torontonians who no longer needed them. 
These tools have been used for building projects, renovations and 
gardening, improving people’s homes and lives in Toronto. By sharing 
instead of buying, we have saved our members over $1 million and reduced
 our collective environmental impact as fewer tools were needed to be 
manufactured, shipped, packaged and landfilled.


The Sharing Depot is the next stage in the evolution of 21st century sharing.A membership will not only give access to these items, but will allow your home to be free of clutter, a leading cause of stress.
While this first project will largely be a real-life experiment, if our memberships meet our targets we anticipate opening more locations across the city and helping others start their own projects abroad. Ultimately we envision Sharing Depots will fill large warehouses (picture Costco) with thousands of items from musical instruments to audio/video equipment for short-term loans at a price that is accessible to all. These larger stores would have their own repair teams that will focus on extending the life of all of our items. Eventually we hope to make partnerships with quality manufacturers who design products specifically for sharing with durability and repair features designed into their products. 


   
The Sharing Depot is a vision for how the future of city living can be. That being said, sharing items is a challenge to both the way our culture has manufactured items and consumed them for the past century. With respect to consumption, the 20th century was largely about mining, manufacturing and waste with almost no thought given to the finite nature of our planet’s resources or where products ended up after their useful life ended.
In the 21st century we must change that. Rather than mining virgin raw materials, we must mine the enormous assets that we have lying around our own homes and cities. Rather than manufacturing, we must focus on re-manufacturing, taking the best of these resources and repurposing them into durable and more efficient products that are built to last. In the 21st century, we want waste to no longer be something that we have to deal with - it should be designed out of the system altogether.
This transition can’t happen without you and that’s why we need your support. Big problems don’t just require big players like governments and multi-national corporations. They also require grassroots organizations and community groups that are on the ground, changing the culture of consumption and access and providing alternatives. These grassroots projects are only as successful as the communities that support them and that’s why crowdfunding campaigns like this one are a necessary part of this transition.





    
This project sounds amazing, where will you be located?
We will have our first Sharing Depot near one of our current locations in Toronto. Depending on how much money we raise, we will open the Sharing Depot either near our East York location or our Parkdale location.
What happens if you don’t raise the $30,000? 
This campaign is an all-or-nothing campaign so if we don’t raise at least $30,000, we won’t open the Sharing Depot. The reason we chose to have this kind of campaign is because as a non-profit organization, we can’t afford to launch this new venture without this minimum amount of money. Rent, inventory and managing this kind of operation simply isn’t possible for our team without at least this minimal fundraising goal. 
The second reason is we don’t even want to open the Sharing Depot without the support of people who will actually use the service. We have learned that good ideas are one thing, but good ideas that people actually choose to invest in are often something different. With this campaign, we hope you will choose to purchase a membership, use the service and spread the word so the Sharing Depot can help shift our culture of consumerism away from ownership and waste.
What happens if you raise more than $30,000?
Every dollar over $30,000 can make a huge difference in terms of the quality and location of the Sharing Depot. The more we raise, the bigger and better our space can be as a significant portion of these funds will go towards paying rent in Toronto. With your support, we will rent the best place we can possibly afford that allows for accessibility and population density to ensure we have the largest impact we can. 
Is the Sharing Depot and the Tool Library the same thing?
No. The Toronto Tool Library has four locations and has a separate membership model than the Sharing Depot will have. To start, we will have both enterprises in the same new location however memberships will be sold separately or a discount of 10% will apply to a combined membership.
I have lots of items to donate - how can I do this?
Amazing! We rely on donations to help us make more items available to our members. To donate lightly used or new items that you think will fit with our Sharing Depot please email us at contact@irbe.org or simply stop by one of our Tool Library locations during our opening hours to drop them off.
I want to volunteer with this project, what opportunities are available?
Currently we are looking for librarians who will help with checkins/checkouts, inventorying items  and enjoy interacting with our members. We are also looking for help with website development, marketing and outreach, app development and sponsorships. If you would like to help out with these or any other areas you think would benefit our projects please email Ryan at ryan@irbe.org.

story:
MUSIC VIDEO - BUY STUFF & DROOL

Hilarious, Ironic, FUN!


What are we all about?

We inspire kids to care for the planet with humor and story. 
Our goals:
  1. Awareness
  2. Kids reflect on their own lifestyle
  3. Kids take action, connect with other kids and are supported in their efforts by interactive programming and great young role models

Hi!  We are the creators of the Kids From Planet Earth, and Nature’s Theater.  For a decade we’ve inspired kids to care about the world around them with playful humor and outrageous stories. 

Our outdoor walking stories, hilarious theatrical stage plays, and now a wacky web series, help kids identify how their life choices affect the health of the planet. 

From climate change to water issues to eating right and more - we help kids become aware with playful humor.  We also believe kids these days will benefit from belonging to something and taking action.

Our new web series, the Kids From Planet Earth, focuses on kids taking action.   Our three young heroes are great role models.  Their mission:  stop all villains (including the buffoonish Major Drool and his nephew Private Buddle) from turning the planet into a giant pile of polluted doo-doo!  Can they do it?  Will they succeed?  We think kids can do anything. 

This is the exciting part.  With your contributions, we will post our new web series online – for FREE – to reach kids everywhere.  We have shot 4 (fifteen minute) episodes - they are in the can; episode one is almost complete.  With your support we will finish editing and post production on episodes 2, 3 and 4. 


Our Goal

With your contributions we will meet our $17,000 campaign goal and use the funds in two, very specific ways: 

1)  Finish editing and post-production work on Episodes 2-4 of the web series--the Kids from Planet Earth.  These are already shot and waiting for an editor's playful eye.     

Episode 1 is mostly done.  We will release it on the web before the end of the campaign.    

2)  Continue to develop the Kids From Plant Earth Club.  Help kids take action!  The club is a vehicle for kids to use their new found awareness and together--with friends and family--take steps toward a sustainable lifestyle.  As part of the club, kids will feel connected to a larger group, have fun and care about where they live.   

WE WON'T STOP with the web series and kids club.  We are committed to creating programs that help kids realize they have the power to do great things.  


What We've Accomplished


  • Buy Stuff & Drool  (MUSIC VIDEO) a topsy turvy music video where our villain, Major Drool, tries to convince everyone, "the solution to every problem --BUY STUFF"!  It has just been released as a push back to Black Friday and Cyber Monday. 

  • Kids from Planet Earth THEATRICAL SHOW – A cast of eleven from 6-62 years old recently toured twelve schools in California.  4,000 kids experienced the Kids from Planet Earth stage show--a show about sustainable living ideas and a trio of kids who have to stop Major Drool from doing bad things to the planet.    This tour was made possible by YSAQMD and Tuleyome - thank you!

  • OTHER STAGE SHOWS:  Junky’s Last Stand (about making healthy food choices) and The Search For King Carbon  (climate change awareness) have captivated audiences with their comedic flare and learning.   Teachers, Parents, Politicians, and most importantly, kids– have given the shows rave reviews.   A shout out to YSAQMD, Cool Davis, Tuleyome and the Davis Community Church here for their support.

  • Nature's Theater (OUTDOOR WALKING STORIES)  Children participate in an interactive story filled with learning, games and adventure.   With over 20 original outdoor walking stories in our Nature’s Theater  repertoire – we use playful fun to help young kids learn about a variety of environmental themes.    The Nature's Theater story books guide you step by step how to run an outing.        www.naturestheater.org

The Future, a.k.a., if WE SURPASS OUR GOAL

We will continue to create programming that inspires kids to become aware and  take action to care for the planet. 

  • FUNNY VIDEOS for the KFPE CLUB - We will focus on creating short, KID ZANY videos that show kids taking action to care for the planet.   For example, imagine a small group of children picking up trash.  As they walk, they discover an endless line of trash before them.  Eventually, the kids notice a villain a block ahead of them gleefully throwing trash from his garbage can.  His goal, keep the kids picking up trash forever.   The kids decide to do something about it.  We can't give it all away here but their solution has something to do with a cute little dog, a hot dog costume and a gallon of milk.   
  • FILM more EPISODES with different themes –In Episodes 1-4, Major Drool encourages people to Buy Stuff without thinking of the consequences.   In future episodes, the kids will battle villains intent on destroying the planet for a host of different ways--from Air Quality to Zebra extinction and everything in between.  


KFPE Gives Back to You

We want to say thank you for contributing and helping our dreams come true.  Everyone needs benefactors and people who support their vision.   We've created some unique thank you gifts, especially for  U,  yew,  and for the (you) who hasn't looked at our site yet, but will.  Enjoy!  For a complete list, take a peak at the sidebar on the right. 

·  $30- Bottle of DROOL JUICE & Membership to the KFPE CLUB

·  $50- DVD of KFPE Web Series & Music Video +

·  $100- YOUR KIDS in a Movie Poster--poised to stop Major Drool.

.  $1,500- Original Rap Song ABOUT YOU!

An Oasis for Kids and Families!

We see media as the moral compass of our times.  The Kids from Planet Earth offers an oasis for kids and families away from where the compass currently points.  Brave, engaged, contributing members of our society need a place to be nurtured and celebrated, especially in their youth.  And it has to be FUN! 

We've created fun and inspiring programming for more than 10 years.    We know how to entertain kids, while imparting a meaningful, positive message.  With your help we will reach an even bigger audience.  This is our life work.  We are in this for the long haul.  We feel it’s what we were put on this Earth to do--be part of the community voice that encourages young and old alike to live in a beneficial and optimal way.

Do You Want to Collaborate?

If you are feeling drawn to our campaign, our mission, we'd love to hear from you.
There are many ways to get involved.  We know that to accomplish our goals we'll need many people working together.  We'd love your help!

Here's a partial list of ways you can get involved with the Kids from Planet Earth!

  • Share our Kids from Planet Earth campaign, the music video, our website  www.kidsfromplanetearth.com  with everyone you know.
  • Post production skills--we are always looking for good editors, and special effects artists.  If you have a particular skill and want to get involved, give us a shout. 
  • Social media specialists--are you a social media master?  Do you want to use your skills to help kids discover the Kids from Planet Earth?  
  • Marketing experts--Yep!
  • Network Contacts (cable, on-line streaming companies) -- do you know someone we can call who might be interested in adapting the Kids from Planet Earth into a TV show?
  •  Lastly – you might know a celebrity who cares about the Earth and about educating kids.   Please reach out and ask him/her to share our campaign on twitter, or one of their social media platforms. 


Thank You!


Thank you so much for taking the time to learn more about us.   

We have seen, in countless ways, how our programming creates positive messages and images in a world very much in need of hope and change. 

 Please contribute to our campaign!

story: I want to raise money for buses to take us to recycling centers to learn how to recycle the right way, visit different eco-friendly centers to volunteer, and get the materials to start a garden in the community.
story_txt: I want to raise money for buses to take us to recycling centers to learn how to recycle the right way, visit different eco-friendly centers to volunteer, and get the materials to start a garden in the community.

story:
Այս նախաձեռնությունը նպատակ ունի հավաքել նվիրատվություններ LED լամպեր գնելու, և Հայաստանի սահմանամերձ համայնքների կարիքավոր բնակիչների բնակարաններում և տներում տեղադրելու նպատակով: Նախաձեռնությունը կնպաստի Էներգախնայողությանը, ծախսերի կրճատմանը և էկոլոգիապես մաքուր տեխնոլոգիաների օգտագործմանը: 


LED լամպերի առավելությունները:

1.  Ծախսում են 10 անգամ ավելի քիչ էլեկտրաէներգիա:

2.  Ունեն 3-6 տարվա կյանքի տևողություն:

3.  Էկոլոգիապես մաքուր են:

4.  Չեն պարունակում ծանր մետաղներ:  

5.  Ենթակա են վերամշակման: 


This initiative aims to raise donations to buy LED bulbs and to set them on border’s communities vulnerable villager’s apartments and homes. Moreover, this initiative aims to promote energy saving, cost reduction, and use of ecologically clean technologies.


Advantages of LED bulbs:

1.  Use 10 times less electricity.

2.  Have 3-6 year lifetime.

3.  Ecologically clean.

4.  Do not contain heavy metals.

5.  Recyclable.
story_txt:
Այս նախաձեռնությունը
նպատակ ունի հավաքել նվիրատվություններ LED լամպեր գնելու, և Հայաստանի սահմանամերձ համայնքների կարիքավոր
բնակիչների բնակարաններում և տներում տեղադրելու նպատակով: Նախաձեռնությունը կնպաստի
Էներգախնայողությանը, ծախսերի կրճատմանը և էկոլոգիապես մաքուր տեխնոլոգիաների օգտագործմանը: LED լամպերի առավելությունները:1.  Ծախսում են
10 անգամ ավելի քիչ էլեկտրաէներգիա:
2.  Ունեն 3-6 տարվա
կյանքի տևողություն:
3.  Էկոլոգիապես մաքուր
են:
4.  Չեն պարունակում
ծանր մետաղներ:  
5.  Ենթակա են վերամշակման: 
This initiative aims
to raise donations to buy LED bulbs and to set them on border’s communities
vulnerable villager’s apartments and homes. Moreover, this initiative aims to
promote energy saving, cost reduction, and use of ecologically clean
technologies.


Advantages of LED bulbs:
1. 
Use 10 times less electricity. 
2. 
Have 3-6 year lifetime. 
3. 
Ecologically clean. 
4. 
Do not contain heavy metals. 
5. 
Recyclable.

story:
Puerto Rico's Humpback Whales!

Protecting marine mammals, including humpback whales, begins with protecting their habitats. We are working hard to understand the role smaller habitats play in the recovery of humpback whales through research.

Humpback whales wintering off Puerto Rico are part of the much larger North Atlantic population. They travel from summer feeding grounds near Canada, the USA, Greenland, and Iceland down to the warmer waters in the Caribbean to give birth and mate. Puerto Rico is one of the small habitats used by humpback whales during winter but we need to understand why this area is important by studying individuals in their natural environment. Only then can we protect their resources and help the population of whales as they continue to recover from centuries of whaling.

We reach out to the public through presentations and education programs with an aim at creating ambassadors for healthy oceans that support whales and other marine life. Our education efforts (including students, interns, and research assistants) are aimed at creating ambassadors and advancing fledgling marine scientists to the benefit of healthy oceans and humans.

Our research team is comprised of the principal investigator (Mithriel MacKay), support staff, research assistants and interns participating in the Humpback Whale Field Intensive program at the Marine and Coastal Ecology Research Center (MCERC). To date, everybody working on this project volunteers!


What We Need & What You Get

We need your support to continue research and education programs. Our goal includes purchasing a small boat for conducting research on the water which will stretch our budget much further than having to charter a boat and captain. We need a theodolite for tracking whales and human activity from land allowing us to collect data without interrupting whales' behaviors. We want to put our programs in the reach of many people by subsidizing internships placing valuable experience in reach of fledgling marine biologists in need of skills helping them compete for jobs aimed at conservation.

Your generosity will go a long way in assuring research and education continue!  You will have the satisfaction of knowing that all donations are applied to efforts that help support the recovery of humpback whales as well as other marine life.

The Impact

Your contribution will have a local, regional, and global impact!  Whales in the Caribbean are the same whales throughout the North Atlantic therefore, supporting research on the winter habitats supports humpback whales throughout the entire ocean!

People who study with us come from all over the United States and the rest of the world! That means if you support this conservation effort you are helping to send people out throughout the globe who are passionate about protecting marine mammals and share that goal with family and friends.

Who We Are?

The Marine and Coastal Ecology Research Center is a Texas nonprofit organization (with a federal 501c3 nonprofit pending) that has been conducting humpback whale research in Puerto Rico, USA, since 2011. MCERC is dedicated to providing research and education opportunities aimed at increasing an investment in conservation and preservation of healthy marine and coastal ecosystems.

MCERC supports scientific research of marine habitats and encourages participation of investigators with a similar mission. We welcome collaborations with scientists and university students who are invested in the MCERC mission.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate financially, you can still help the humpback whales by spreading the word about MCERC and our Indiegogo campaign through Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, or any other social media site you use, help us spread the word!

story:
THANK YOU!!!

We have reached our goal in the campaign thanks to 70 donations!

Because we have reached our goal, the campaign will remain up as an 'InDemand' campaign.  Over the coming days we will be adjusting perk offerings and adding new ones as they become available.  Please continue to follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and/or Instagram to stay up to date on offerings and our continued progress!

 

 

 

 

Images of Swag Below

A number of packages have been created, but if you don't see a package that fits your needs, let us know and we will tell you how to score what you are after.  Please share the campaign with others too.

 

Family Owned and Sustainably Operated

Hello, we are Dayna and David Beddick.  Together with our family and friends, we have been working towards the goal of opening a sustainable brewery.  Environmental stewardship has been a core value throughout our lives and we continue to incorporate personal changes to improve the environment.

Our intention in opening a brewery is to deliver a high quality, hand crafted product utilizing numerous technologies to do so an environmentally responsible way.  We have actively designed our building to take advantage of solar positioning and will minimize energy usage by including LED lighting, energy efficient appliances, and bio-based insulation made of soybeans and recycled plastic bottles.

Reducing our energy usage is only a part of the equation.  We hope to generate our own renewable energy by incorporating two solar technologies.  First, we will use a series of flat plate collectors to pre-heat the strike and sparge water during the brewing process.  The collectors will utilize the power of the Florida sun to heat the water to over 165 F.  Second, we will start with a small photovoltaic (PV) array to generate electricity to supplement the energy consumed in our all electric, 3-phase electric brewhouse.

Our cost for the PV array is just over $3,000 per kW.  Here is where we would like for you to help us.  We are requesting donations to increase our solar capacity during the build process so that we can take the greatest advantage of the technologies and production of energy.  In exchange for your donations to this worthy environmental cause, we will reward you with various gifts to help you show your support for Increased Solar at A Little Madness Brewing Company.

 

Perks

We are offering a number of different donation levels to reward you.  From glassware and coasters to shirts and growlers, there is a little something for everyone.  Also, ALL donations will receive a FREE die cut sticker of the A Little Madness Brewing Company logo AND donations greater than $20 will receive a FREE specialty Madness Pint Glass.  

We will also be hosting a donors' party at the Brewery as we get closer to opening.  As a donor you will be invited to attend this private party as part of our soft opening process.  We look forward to rewarding our founding sponsors at this event.

No brewery Indiegogo campaign would be complete without offering #FREEBEER. So, in true THOR the Brewer fashion, every order will receive a custom poker chip that can be redeemed for a beverage at the #brewery.

  • Glassware = 1 chip
  • T Shirt = 2 chips
  • Growler = 3 chips
  • Disc Golf/Yoga = 4 chips
  • Mug Club = 5 chips

Specialty Madness Pint Glass  $9 +s/h

Get a thoughtfully designed pint glass emblazened with the A Little Madness Brewing Company logo. The glass is designed to enhance your beer drinking experience, check it out:

  • Narrow base for a more natural hold.
  • Thin, angled rim to deliver a refreshing, even sip (or more) of fine craft beer.
  • Laser etched nucleation point in the bottom of the glass releases carbonation, lifting aromas from the beer.
  • Open bell to collect the bountiful aromas of hops and malts. For your enjoyment of craft beer!

     

Set of 4 Coasters made from Reclaimed Material $7 + s/h

You will get a set of four 4" round black smooth neoprene pieces that were reclaimed from a rubber seal & gasket manufacturing facility.

We've had our logo added in various colors to upcycle them into a new life!  So show your support of the Madness and help to keep usable waste material from ending up in the landfill!

#Sustainable

 

Pair of Std Madness Pint Glass  $15 + s/h

Get yourself a pair of standard pint glasses with the A Little Madness Brewing Company logo to show your support for our solar project.  Free Sticker with this donation!

Men's Madness T-Shirt  $20 + s/h

Score this sharp looking t-shirt printed with the Madness logo in white on the front and our favorite pint glass on the back.  Don't forget you will get a FREE specialty Madness Pint Glass to with your new t-shirt and a sticker!

Please specify size when completing order. Sizes may be limited by demand.

#FUNDtheMadness

Women's Madness T-Shirt  $20 + s/h

Big Logo up front. Madness pint on the back. 

Don't forget you will get a FREE specialty Madness Pint Glass to with your new t-shirt and a sticker!

Please specify size when completing order. Sizes may be limited by demand.

#FUNDtheMadness

 

ALMBC - Stainless Keg Growler  $50 + s/h

Do you need to carry around 64 oz. of hand crafted brew? Then you need this awesome mini-keg to do just that! A rugged stainless steel growler with keg handles and emblazoned with the A Little Madness Brewing Company logo. You will also receive one FREE growler fill of hand crafted beer once we are up and running. Show how Mad you are about your craft beer!  FREE pint glass and sticker!

Yoga Mat Reward Package

We can't wait until we are having Beer Yoga events at the brewery, but why wait until then. You can score an awesome Yoga mat and transport strap sporting the A Little Madness logo! But wait that's not all!!! We are throwing in a brewery shirt and our specialty pint glass FREE as well. Namaste!

 

Disc Golf Package

Disc golf is great. Disc golfing with hand crafted beer is even greater! Now you can show your support for ALMBC while throwing some sweet plastic. This reward package includes a Dynamic Discs Fuzion Evidence Midrange disc, a t-shirt, and our specialty pint glass all emblazoned with the A Little Madness Logo!

 

 Early Stages Madness Mug Club  $150

Your very own mug will be waiting for you at the brewery. You will be allowed to pick your double digit number and take advantage of many special offers. Purchase includes an exclusive invite to the early stages of Madness Mug Club Social at the brewery where you will get to meet your mug and begin to take advantage of some of the benefits of Madness Mug Club Membership.

While we are still finalizing the details, there will be a number of great benefits to being a member of this exclusive founding club:

  • personalized, handled mug
  • larger pours for the same price
  • weekly discount specials
  • discounts on growler fills
  • first beer of each new run free 
  • private Members only Madness Mug Club events

 

Extremely Mad Donations

So you are extremely excited about helping out our Madness that you not only want to donate, but have a say in future operations?  Well here are some perks just for you.  We are allowing you the freedom to name*** our beautiful pieces of stainless steel for an appropriate donation.  The name  you choose will not only be proudly displayed on the equipment, but the names will forever be used when operating A Little Madness Brewing Company.  As an example:

"Hey Yinz guys brewing up a new batch of that Lavender Iron Wit on the Hatter's Revenge?"

"The MyPA is finished fermenting, so its time to rack it out of Aunt Sally's Sippy and into the brite tank."

  • $1500 = 15 bbl Brite Tank
  • $3000 = 7 bbl Fermentation Vessel
  • $6000 = 15 bbl Fermentation Vessel (1)
  • $6000 = 15 bbl Fermentation Vessel (2)
  • $7500 = 7 bbl Electric Brewhouse

***Because the names will be proudly displayed for all to see at the brewery, we will not accept anything that does not meet our standards regarding decency and appropriateness.  

All naming donations will receive a full swag pack for FREE as a thank you.  This will include membership into the mug club, a pair of T-shirts, four specialty pint glasses, a stainless steel growler, the yoga mat, the disc golf plastic, and whatever else we have on hand to give you.

 

All proceeds raised will go to support sustainable causes at the brewery.  While our goal is set at $3,333, no matter what amount we raise it will be used to add to our solar collection capabilities.

 

The Impact

We have utilized solar technologies at home and are very excited to increase the production of renewable energy as we build the brewery.  We will continue to be responsible advocates for the environment as we continue to grow in the future.  Your donations at this point will have the greatest impact by allowing us to increase generation as soon as possible.

 

Risks & Challenges

For those who have been following us for awhile, you know that we have continually overcome a number of challenges to bring our brewery to life.  We had to change land use codes through lengthy process that involved numerous boards and votes.  The battle continued as we moved forward through the conditional usage process and ultimately to the obtaining of our development order.

While we still have to move through the federal TTB process as well as additional state regulations, we are certainly not slowing down.  We have been preparing for this development for several years now and are committed to seeing our dream come to fruition.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to donate their money to our campaign.  We do ask everyone to spend a minute to share our campaign with as many others as possible so that we can spread the word about the great things we are doing at A Little Madness Brewing Company.

http://www.facebook.com/ALittleMadnessBrewingCompany

#FUNDtheMadness

Thank you so much for all your support!  Cheers!

story:
Hello! Thank you for your interest!

For a farmer in Senegal, participation in the organic industry is practically inaccessible. In order to earn a premium for his/her crops, organic farmers seeking certification must rely solely on European agencies who rack up unfathomable bills. Facilitate financial freedom  is possible for farmers in Senegal and in turn create incentive for sustainable food production and environmental stewardship through participation in a more accessible and incentive Organic Movement.

Our plan is to set up a branch of an already accredited USDA certified agency which is much more promising than if we attempted to accredit an African grass roots organization into the EU organic program at this point.  

Traveling is the number one expense to and while in Senegal. I am requesting funding to help cover my traveling costs while in Senegal as well as other associated travel expenses and fees. I will use these funds to live modestly while I research the potential of this region and develop grant funding information. Any amount of money left over will serve as the initial certification fees for the organization which will be safeguarded until the first audit by the USDA National Organic Program costing upwards of $12,000 or more.  Once I gather enough information on-site, I will be better equipped to write grants to major organizations, requesting the necessary funding in order to see it through. The more support I receive through this platform, the less grant funding will be needed and the more efficient we can be in moving forward!

Why become accredited or affiliated with a certification agency? In brief, this recognition will boost the confidence consumers have in organic produce in Senegal on a local scale. On a larger scale, it will give farmers the option to export their products abroad as buyers will recognize their third-party verification. Without access to an organically certified agency, organic farmers are currently feeling the pressure to conform to conventional agricultural practices, in turn destructing the soil further, and not to mention increasing community health risks due to harmful toxin exposure from pesticides which we all hopefully know by now lead to cancer and birth defects.

Since 2008 I have been working with the founder of SAPOA (Senegalese Association for the Promotion of Organic Agriculture, formed in 1989) to develop a plan to become accredited with the EU and/or USDA. Currently, this independent NGO works with grower associations to promote organic agriculture and agro-forestry practices in the environmentally decimated region of the Sahel desert. SAPOA inspects and certifies organic farms under his label which does not hold international recognition. The founder is on the board of the Senegalese Organic Standards and SAPOA is accredited with IFOAM (International Foundation for Organic Agriculture Movement).

Financial support is our only identified obstacle at present.  We appreciate and rely on your contributions!

will use these funds to live modestly while I research the potential of this
region and develop grant funding information. Any amount of money left over
will serve as the initial certification fees for the organization which will be
safeguarded until the first audit by the USDA National Organic Program costing
upwards of $12,000 or more.  Once I
gather enough information on-site, I will be better equipped to write grants to
major organizations, requesting the necessary funding in order to see it
through. The more support I receive through this platform, the less grant
funding will be needed and the more efficient we can be in moving forward!
Why become accredited or affiliated with a certification agency?
In brief, this recognition will boost the confidence consumers have in organic
produce in Senegal on a local scale. On a larger scale, it will give farmers
the option to export their products abroad as buyers will recognize their third-party
verification. Without access to an organically certified agency, organic
farmers are currently feeling the pressure to conform to conventional
agricultural practices, in turn destructing the soil further, and not to
mention increasing community health risks due to harmful toxin exposure from
pesticides which we all hopefully know by now lead to cancer and birth defects.
Since 2008 I have been working with the founder of SAPOA
(Senegalese Association for the Promotion of Organic Agriculture, formed in
1989) to develop a plan to become accredited with the EU and/or USDA.
Currently, this independent NGO works with grower associations to promote
organic agriculture and agro-forestry practices in the environmentally decimated region
of the Sahel desert. SAPOA inspects and certifies organic farms under his
label which does not hold international recognition. The founder is on the board
of the Senegalese Organic Standards and SAPOA is accredited with
IFOAM (International Foundation for Organic Agriculture Movement). 
Financial support is our only identified obstacle at
present.  We appreciate and rely on your contributions!

story:
IMPORTANT : Some of you receive a message that your payment was unsuccessful. If it happens to you, that's because your bank doen't recognise the Indiegogo platform and blocked the payment immediately. So try another card or contact your bank to authorise them to pay in INDIEGOGO.

THANK YOU

Im Video wählen Sie einfach in den Einstellungen den Untertitel in Deutsch aus.

Dans la video, vous avez l'option de mettre les sous-titres en français en cliquant sur la roue des settings.

En la video podéis elegir los subtítulos en español, haz un click en la rueda de los settings para cambiar a tu idioma.

    

 

We're a skincare company inspired by natural ingredients that work magic on your skin. 

Organic, vegan, and cruelty-free. Wisdom Cares is the solution for anyone who wouldn't put anything on their skin they wouldn't trust eating, knowing that everything we put on our skin quickly absorbs into our bodies.

Now, we're expanding our product line, and we want YOU to join the adventure!

It's our mission to protect YOU and the PLANET.

 

 

 

We are proud to present you our new line :

Ocean-Friendly Sunscreen "NOMADE" & Eco-Friendly Shampoo Bar "PAPAYA"

Sunscreen & Shampoo to protect our health and our planet.

We're done with nasty chemicals.

We're done with disappointing natural sunscreens.

We're done with plastic.

We are launching a natural sunscreen & an organic shampoo bar, both vegan,

in all of Europe with new formulas 

and 100% recyclable packaging (yessssss).

No scary ingredients. No plastic. No animal abuse.

Just 100% natural, daily skin protection and safe shampoo.

 

    

 

HOW CHEMICALS AFFECT YOUR HEALTH

 

There’s a difference between what we ingest versus what we put on our skin.

When we eat food, the enzymes in our saliva and stomach help break down

chemicals and flush them out.

When we put something on our skin, it goes straight to

our organs through our bloodstream and doesn’t filter out the toxins at all.

THIS CAN PROVOKE CANCER, INFERTILITY AND AFFECT HORMONES

Our skin is the largest organ in our body,

so why do we slather it with artificial and dangerous chemicals?

 

 

HOW CHEMICALS AFFECT THE OCEANS

 

When we shower, the toxic chemicals of our shampoo

- Fragrance - Sodium laureth sulfate - Parabens - DMDM hydantoin -

ENTER OUR WATERWAYS.

 When we swim, toxic chemicals of our sunscreen

- Oxybenzone - Octinoxate - Octocrylene - Benzophenone 1 & 8 - AND MUCH MORE

WASH OFF IN OUR OCEANS.

 

    

 

NOMADE brings you

PROTECTION WITHOUT POLLUTION

Most people know that sunscreen is full of chemicals

that affect our health and the marine life, right?

Yet still, we take this for granted, applying synthetic beauty products with little consideration for the impact on our bodies and the environment. 

At Wisdom Cares, we have designed sunscreen that combines skin and environmental care.

Our objective is to offer sun care that has minimal impact on our shared environment.

Products that we are free to enjoy and move us all closer towards a plastic and chemical free life.

Developed with leading experts in natural skincare and tested to European standards

- the highest in global sunscreen regulation - 

Our new sunscreen NOMADE combines mineral and organic-based filters to provide 

100% natural sun protection against both UVA and UVB rays.

 

 

However, we go one step further.

NOMADE provides sun protection and also nourishment and rejuvenation

through a combination of ingredients that harness the power of nature. 

Add UV protection to your daily skincare routine, whatever the weather.

We need sunscreen to prevent sun damage and ageing.

We think it's safe to assume we all want the same from sunscreen.

We want natural protection that works, feels nice on our skin,

and at the same time cares for the world we live in.

Enriched with algae extract, and tamanu oil, Nomade sunscreen provides protection and hydration.

In addition, antioxidant and antibacterial properties from carrot oil nourish the skin, preventing irritation and breakouts. 

 

 

We've also created a sport version, with a tinted face sun protection SPF 50,

designed for surfers and ocean lovers.

Water and sweat-resistance comes from natural and vegan candelilla wax and tinted from cacao. 

Candelilla wax is a plant based wax and a vegan alternative to beeswax. 

Like beeswax, it is skin conditioning, easily absorbed, odourless, and rich in nutrients.

 

    

 

So what's the problem with normal sunscreen?

Traces of these chemical filters absorb through the skin into the bloodstream and have been detected in urine and breast milk too. 

No to uncertain chemicals. Simply nature’s best.

 

 

We want TO MAKE THE SWITCH TO SOLID SHAMPOO BARS for several reasons

SHAMPOO BARS ARE PLASTIC-FREE PACKAGING

This is by far the number one reason to make the switch to shampoo bars.  

A million plastic bottles are bought around the world every minute and the number is projected to jump another 20% by 2021. Just 7% of those collected were turned into new bottles. That means, approximately 93% of the 480 billion plastic water bottles sold in 2019 

ended up in landfill or in the ocean.

 

 

SHAMPOO BARS ARE GREAT FOR TRAVEL

Shampoo bars are great to travel with as you don't have to worry about any potential for spillage or liquid restrictions. The bars are perfect for carry on as not only are they small and lightweight, they are TSA approved, which means you don’t have to plan your packing around your hair care products! And best of all, they help prevent using the individual-sized shampoos at your hotel, which goes back to point #1 about reducing packaging waste.

 

SHAMPOO BARS ARE MULTI-PURPOSE

Shampoo bars can also be used for other purposes like washing your body, your pets in a pinch or your clothes while camping or travelling! 

 

 

After months of trial, we were still left wanting for something that would perform better for us. So we went down the path of formulating our own bars and PAPAYA was born.

 

 

 

Zero-plastic packaging. Recycled, recyclable, and reusable.

We believe in products that are ocean and eco-friendly.

Not just the product but the packaging too. 

Yes, sadly a lot of natural brands are selling their products in plastic or unnecessary packaging.

That's doesn't make sense at all! It's like going only half way of an environmental change.

So in Wisdom cares, we provide an alternative with glass bottles and aluminium containers.

First, it’s important to note that glass is endlessly recyclable, back to its original use. It never loses its quality and purity, no matter how many times it’s recycled. Plus, glass has an almost zero rate of chemical interactions, which ensures that the products inside a glass bottle keep all their qualities.

Then we chose aluminium containers for our sunscreen face SPF 50 because they are made from recycled aluminium, plus they can be recycled again and reused.

 

 

You're told that plant-based plastics are biodegradable, but they will only break down in an industrial composting facility, not your average garden compost bin. They won’t biodegrade at all buried in a landfill. There, they will sit for hundreds or thousands of years like any other piece of plastic waste.

That's not all... The recycling infrastructure isn't yet in place which means that most bio-plastics can't even be recycled. 

So out of the options currently available, we believe that the best way to go is :

Recycled | Reusable | Recyclable

 

    

 

Wisdom Cares is an indie skincare brand that was bootstrapped from the ground up.

We would like to continue working this way as it gives us the freedom to experiment and grow organically without pressure to compromise who we are. 

We're asking for 25,000 EUR  so we can continue to spread our Wisdom for a sustainable living. 

 

Where will the money go?

The funds raised on Indiegogo will be used to :

  • Purchase packaging
  • Pay for laboratory production
  • Get the Vegan and Organic certifications
  • Cover trademarking fees
  • Attend industry-leading trade shows

With the expansion of our line, we are hoping to have our new products in the hands of retail buyers across Europe. To do this, we need to stay top of mind at industry leading events. Costs to attend these events can be quite high.

 

We’ve already formulated our recipes and sourced the ingredients for our new products.

That means we’re ready to start producing once the Indiegogo funds are received.

Manufacturing takes about 6-8 weeks, so you can expect to receive all your products in time for the Summer season.

 

    

 

Wisdom Cares is a young startup founded three years ago by Herbalist and Creative director, Chloé Millet. Already in a vegan lifestyle and avoiding any chemicals, she was shocked about all the lies the beauty industry can make you believe, knowing the tonnes of toxic chemicals they use, the animal testing and the abusive amount of plastic contaminating the environment.

Slowly we are growing, and now, Melissa Mostowys joined the adventure as Digital Marketing Strategist Director and she is deeply involved in creating a better world.

Ali Al-Ebrahim joins the adventure as Visual Director and also brings a lot of support in our vision.

As consumers look for natural skincare products and plastic-reduction, we are effectively working to provide a high-quality, ecological solution currently lacking in the European market.

 

 

Thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign.

If you have any questions, please reach out. We’re here to help.

 

 

    

 

We have already completed our formulations with our laboratory, sourced packaging, and designed labels, so we are confident we will be able to deliver all products on time. However, if we are delayed in our production schedule, you'll be the first to know. 

We acknowledge the inevitable risks in our first production run, which could potentially lead to delayed production and consequently, delivery.

Our customers are always our number 1 priority, and we truly believe that transparent communication is key.

We are 100% committed to providing timely and detailed communication!

Please note that we ship out of Barcelona to all Europe.

THANK YOU

story:
Short Summary

Lost fishing gear like nets, pods and lines pose a big thraet to marine life. Turtles, dolfins, sharks, marine birds and fish all run a big risk to get entangled in what we call ghost nets and perish in a horrible manner.

We are divers, and we care. Therefore we startred a foundation that aims to remove as much derelict fishing geqar as possible.

Setting up projects like these cost a lot of money and our personal funds are unsufficient to enable us to do what we think needs to be done.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to set up projects to document the amount of derelict fishing gear so we can show the world the size of the problem and of course remove the gear from the waters.

Our first project will be iun the Adriatic in the vicinity of Krnica where we know there are lots of wrecks covered with nets. 

What do you get out of it ?  You will be able to see the reulsts from our work, an dhave the satisfying feeling of being part of the solution.

The Impact

Removing nets will mean less unnecessary dead animals and less garbage in the sea.

Other Ways You Can Help

Look at our website and like our facebook page.

www.ghostfishing.org

https://www.facebook.com/ghostfishing

 

Rest assured that what we do not spend on this project will go to future projects.
