I believe this will be a good way to bring attention to the fracking as well as an avenue for spiritual healing. We need it after all of the heartbreak and stress this venture endures.
My Drive
I am excited about this book it has been very healing for me to write and I thank you for being a part of my story.I have decided to publish this book through self-publishing, (Outskirts Press) because time is of the essence.Today the fracking is quickly invading our piece of the Earth.
My plan is that with funding help I can have this book ready to publish by March 1st, 2013. The amount of money I am asking for is $8,000 in order to make it a unique book that will also be an inovative way in bringing awareness to the people who have the power to ban fracking.
If there is any additional funding from the book, it will be used for the 2013 Chief Mountain Water Walk. We are all in this together, so everyone world wide is invited to join us on our spiritual walk to honor, bless and protect all waters.
Financial List for 48 page book:

56 Artist Illistrations 
Graphic clean up and layout 
Book Publishing 
Editing 
Gas for travel 
Additional books to keep on hand for speaker gifts at antifracking meetings. 
Additional 500 books to give to Blackfeet community college, Blackfeet Elementary, Junior High schools and library for free.

story:
“There may be people who feel no need for nature. They are fortunate perhaps. But for those of us who feel otherwise, who feel something is missing unless we can hike across land disturbed only by our footsteps or see creatures roaming freely as they have always done, we are sure there should be wilderness.”

-  Mardy Murie (1902-2003); Conservationist; Recipient; US Presidential Medal of Freedom

(from "An Unspoken Hunger" by Terry Tempest Williams)

 

THE ADVENTURE: A COMMITMENT TO THE EARTH

What happens when you shift from living a life of fast cars and roaring crowds to that of an Earth Pilgrim? For renowned South African racecar driver Geoff Dalglish, it's a personal calling to leave only footprints as he walks the world raising awareness and support for wild nature. Geoff believes that “if you see life as a miraculous journey, it will take you to amazing places,” and he is leading by example. In Geoff’s words, “This journey is about both nature and spirit, because I believe they are inseparable…and vital for our future on Planet Earth.”

His goal is to ultimately walk 15,500 miles (25,000 km), the equivalent of the Earth’s circumference, through a series of adventures across the planet.

On the Trail to Salamanca, Geoff will hike 1,500 mi, crossing six countries and four major mountain ranges to document and draw attention to the opportunities presented by the remarkable return across Europe of wilderness, wildlife, and ecological corridors!

Geoff embarked on his trek June 2, 2013, in Geneva, Switzerland, and will end at the 10th World Wilderness Congress (WILD10) in Salamanca, Spain, this October. 

He "walks in faith" as he knows it's the right thing to do and people of his like mind and heart will support this journey for the good of earth and all its life. He needs your help to complete this epic adventure.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

We must raise $24,500 to complete his journey, and one thing you can do - quite literally - is buy miles for Geoff.

Twenty-five dollars will cover 1.5 miles (2.5 km). Along the way, Geoff will send back stories and images of Europe’s re-wilding. For each level of giving, you receive varying forms of thanks and gifts, such as a signed copy of Geoff’s book, "Lost and Found: From Racecar Driver to Earth Pilgrim, from Soweto to Findhorn."

 

DONATE & CREATE A SOCIAL MOVEMENT

Make some noise. Giving can also take the form of sharing our campaign with as many of your friends and family as possible. With Indiegogo's easy sharing tools, it takes two seconds and brings a little extra good news to the people you care about.

The total expense is an estimate to cover 5 months of the Trail to Salamanca - international airfare to and from South Africa (economy) for Geoff; equipment; GPS and telephone accounts; 5 months living expenses on the walk and then in Salamanca. All planning expenses - 1 month, three organizations - are donated by the organizations and by WILD10.  No per diems or personal fees are being paid. Geoff is a volunteer, completely.  If any funding remains at the end, it will be used in the WILD10 scholarship fund for delegates from developing countries.

*Please note: WILD10, the 10th World Wilderness Congress, is the flagship program of The WILD Foundation (with many international partners and collaborators). WILD is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization whose legal name is the "International Wilderness Leadership Foundation." 

THE FOOTPRINT

Geoff's journey is proof that you can make remarkable discoveries by treading lightly and lovingly upon the Earth. We hope you can help and join us in celebrating this success story to “make the world a wilder place.”

See you on the trail!

story:
1 AVENTURE VECUE PAR LES ENFANTS ET RACONTEE POUR LES ENFANTS

Cette expédition à la voile sert de prétexte et de support visuel pour sensibiliser le jeune public à la protection des Océans.

L'ensemble du trip s'organisera autour de rencontres prévues (et imprévues) avec des personnages internationaux légitimes de porter un message de sensibilisation: Scientifiques, acteurs locaux du littoral, professionnels, pratiquants des sports nautiques etc...

Notre équipe de professionels ( en Mer et à Terre) va produire une série d'EPISODES WEBDOCUMENTAIRES (cross-médias) sous la forme de magazines numériques multimédias.

THEMATIQUES ABORDEES 

1 OCEAN RESSOURCE Production et cycle de l'eau douce,Le garde manger de la planète ( pêche, algues et écosystèmes) Biodiversité et santé Captation du CO2 

1 OCEAN FRAGILE Prévention: déchets ( plastiques, hydrocarbures et transports maritimes) Economie eau Gestion et protection espèces Urbanisation du littoral et impacts 

LA SOBRIETE HEUREUSE La vie sur un voilier en famille est un bon exemple de réduction de ses consommations et de son impact sur l'environnement.L'idée est de reproduire certains comportements nécessaires à bord d'un voilier dans notre quotidien à Terre. 


AIDEZ NOUS A PRODUIRE 1 MAXIMUM DE NUMEROS  ;)


Le budget collecté va nous permettre d'indemniser des professionnels qui valorisent à terre les contenus captés en mer ( montage, infographie, développement interface web, crédit musicaux etc...) et de compléter le matériel de tournage embarqué à bord.

story:
The Problem:

Marine debris has been around for a long time. And studies have suggested that the problem is only getting worse as we use more and more plastics each year. This debris is coming onto the beaches and killing wildlife at an increasing rate. In the Pacific, the plastics that find their way into the ocean from coastal nations and the shipping and fishing industries get into the gyre often referred to as the "Great Pacific Garbage Patch". It is estimated that approximately 15-20 tons are being dumped on the beaches of the island of Hawaii each year.  And experts suggest that the extra debris from the 2011 Japanese tsunami will only add to the problem.

What's Being Done Now:

Most of the beach clean-up by HWF  is being done manually.  Currently all large netting debris is being retrieved by a 4 ton  winch on a truck. All of the smaller net fragments and other debris (bottles, toys, tires, PVC pipe, bottle caps, toothbrushes, etc., etc., ) is gathered by hand, bagged, and loaded into trucks. It is a very difficult and tedious task which involves a lot of effort. See video to watch one net being removed from the beach.

With the funds that are collected, we can purchase additional equipment for the HWF that will make the process much more efficient and effective.

 

 

 

Our Goal:

We are raising money for the purchase of heavy-machinery to be donated to the Hawaii Wildlife Fund to help them and all their volunteers in their relentless task of removing marine debris from Hawaii's beautiful beaches.

If the goal of raising enough money to purchase all of this equipment (either new or used) is not reached within 4 months, the entirety of the funds collected will be donated to the Hawaii Wildlife Fund, to be used in their continuing efforts to restore the natural beauty of Hawaii's beaches.

What We Can Do:

The purchased machinery will consist of a small (30-45 HP) tractor, with a front-end loader and attachments, carried by a trailer. The machinery will help with the retrieving and loading of the larger marine debris (mainly nets) that are too large to handle by hand. It can also be equipped with a stone fork, which is useful in collecting and removing mid-sized debris.

 

How This Equipment Can Help:

The main equipment that is being considered for purchase is a small (30 - 40 HP) tractor with a front end loader attachment.

Along with this there as an attachment called a stone fork which looks like a very large pitchfork. This attachment on the tractor will enable a person to lift the nets without having to manhandle them as is being done now and with some modification of the forks sift the sand for debris of various sizes.This tractor would also be usful in our efforts doing some wildlife habitat restoration work.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, there are still things you can do to help out.  Visit the Hawaii Wildlife Fund marine debrise cleanup webpage to see how you can help: http://wildhawaii.org/marinelife/threats.html

Also if you care to make a larger donation and need the tax credit for income tax purposes, you may go directly to the Hawaii Wildlife Fund and make the donation directly.

Follow the HWF on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/hawaiiwildlifefund

story:
*Please note that some of the photos and videos posted are not suitable for more sensitive viewers. Thank you

 

Landmark Foundation Leopard and Predator Project

 

Landmark Foundation was founded in 2004 in an effort to combat the loss of biodiversity. The NGO has established a leopard and predator rescue, rehabilitation, release and research program: The Leopard and Predator Project. This project spans approximately 4,5 million hectares between the Western and Eastern Cape of South Africa and is now expanding into the Northern regions of the country.

To date we have been privileged to save 41 leopards from certain death, but have also lost 43 leopards in that time. These deaths were caused by either gin-traps, from poisons or hunting. Our interactions with these leopards, both successes and failures, have given an opportunity to collect data including genetic samples. Of those we have been able to rescue, 24 have been collared with GPS devices, making the research project one of the largest research studies on leopard in the world.

Less than 20% of South Africa’s landscape is protected (by the state or privately) and our efforts are not limited to these fragments. We focus on establishing regional scale connectivity of leopard and other indigenous migratory wildlife populations across the country by working with private landowners. Private landowners make up 80% of South Africa’s land containing much of the country’s biodiversity. Here we can ensure that the leopard, along with other species, has enough habitat available to ensure their survival for future generations. Our research indicates that leopards in the Cape are in dire need of conservation action. In fact their regional survival is perilously dependent on these conservation efforts as their local populations have become isolated to small population groupings in protected areas. This has resulted in the local populations being genetically isolated from regionally similar groupings and facing a genetic abyss through this bottleneck. Conservation action thus HAS to focus on establishing and maintaining genetic corridors or mechanisms to ensure the species survival. The threat to leopards has effectively created artificially isolated populations. Conservation thus has to re-establish genetic linkages if the species is to survive regionally. This ambition underpins all our activities.

We have a strong advocacy campaign against indiscriminate lethal controls such as gin-traps which often catch all species from small antelope and porcupine to jackal and leopard, as they are unselective devices, never mind barbarically cruel. Much of our efforts are spent on informing and providing farmers with ecologically acceptable and ethical means of reducing conflict between humans and predators. This has included the use of livestock guardian dogs, alpacas, various livestock protection collars, breed selection and management strategies which all protect livestock from predators. These practices replace indiscriminant controls such as gin-traps, poisons and hunting dog packs commonly used to eradicate predators on farmlands. With lethal controls removed from these farms, they become potential corridors between protected areas for species that are not contained by fences, and in so doing link populations genetically. By using these ecologically and ethically acceptable measures, biodiversity is not threatened. Furthermore, production studies have indicated dramatic successes in improved livestock production when using such management practices.

Landmark Foundation has expanded habitats for predators through the establishment of private nature reserves, working with cooperative landowners and participating farmers. In essence we promote a change from predator control to livestock protection, which has proven to be better for biodiversity and more profitable.

Our main objectives are:

  • Rescue, rehabilitation and release of injured or captured species, with a particular focus on leopards;

  • Advocacy to ban gin-traps, hunting dogs and poison traps;

  • Research into leopard ecology and management at landscape level;

  • Instituting ethical and ecologically acceptable management methodologies on participating farms;

  • Developing a green brand (Fair Game) and consumer awareness for the public to make a difference;

  • Education of scholars and the general public regarding predators, often using arts and culture that promotes our natural heritage; and

  • Increasing suitable landscape / habitat for predators and biodiversity outside of protected areas.

 

What We Need & What You Get

With this campaign, Landmark Foundation's Leopard and Predator Project is looking to receive approximately $100 000.

Where does the money go?
Landmark Foundation is built on trust, transparency and effective action on the ground. The figures below are working costs involved in the running of the project. Funds received are allocated where they are needed most, unless a sponsor would like to donate to something specific.

  • Livestock Protection Collar - Dead Stop

  • Basic educational resource pack per school (250 pupils -posters & activity sheets)

  • E-Shepherd alarm collar per sheep

  • Survey field cameras (with batteries and card for one year)

  • New tyres for field work vehicle

  • A livestock guardian dog (with food and veterinary care for the 1st year of life)

  • A pair of alpacas

  • GPS collar for leopard (on average we rescue 7 leopards each year)

  • Fuel necessary to travel to the different locations where predators are being targeted


As we have chosen the flexible funding strategy, any and all funds received will go directly to funding the projects no matter if we reach our goal or not.

 

Perks!

$5- Landmark Foundation sticker

$25- Landmark Foundation cap

$100- Landmark Foundation Shirt and cap

$150- 'Dead Stop' collars placed on 35 sheep or goats. 'Dead Stop' collars are manufactured using a broad metal mesh, which is epoxy-coated. Collars are fitted around the entire neck, with different sizes for different sized livestock. On certain farms, these collars have had up to a 100% decrease in deaths due to predation. These collars are hardy and can be re-used over extended periods.

$200- Soup Kitchen. Landmark Foundation will host a soup kitchen to feed people in a local township.

$600- 'Dead Stop' collars placed on 150 sheep or goats. 'Dead Stop' collars are manufactured using a broad metal mesh, which is epoxy-coated. Collars are fitted around the entire neck, with different sizes for different sized livestock. On certain farms, these collars have had up to a 100% decrease in deaths due to predation. These collars are hardy and can be re-used over extended periods.

$1000- Guarding dog, alpaca, or donkey. Shepard dogs are trained as puppies, they bond and live exclusively with their flock. Each of these guarding animals will confront and scare off predators, eliminating the need for lethal control methods.

$10,000- Skydiving Event. If the campaign receives $10 000, each of the Landmark Foundation team will skydive.

 

Why Predators?

Predators play an essential role in the ecosystem, keeping them healthy and balanced. The leopard is the last remaining apex predator in the Western and Eastern Cape.

  • It is an umbrella species and requires large areas of habitat and by conserving them many other animals are automatically conserved.

  • Less than 20% of South African landscapes are formally protected, this is not enough to ensure any species’ existence therefore conservation on private land is also needed.

  • Traditional predator control has had a significantly detrimental impact on biodiversity. The Cape fox and Riverine rabbit are rare and vulnerable to extinction. Lethal controls continue to impact on their populations.

  • Farmers are still battling with livestock losses even though predators have been gin-trapped, poisoned, hunted and killed for centuries in an effort to reduce their livestock losses. The problem of livestock losses is reportedly worse now than ever before, indicating these methods are ineffective.

The Cape lion became extinct in 1858 and the brown hyena and cheetah disappeared from most of the area in the 1900s. Due to their elusive nature and adaptability, leopard still fight for survival today. They have managed to remain in inhospitable and mountainous regions. As habitat diminishes and agriculture and game farming practices keep lethal controls in play, they, along with many other species, have little hope of survival and will soon face the same fate as the long extinct Cape lion. Private landowners are thus key in conserving these animals.

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you can't contribute monetarily, that doesn't me you can't help! Please share this campaign in any way possible. We are on Facebook and Twitter(@landmarkleopard), or you can visit our website (www.landmarkfoundation.org.za)

Why Predators?
Predators play an essential role in the ecosystem, keeping them healthy and balanced. The leopard is the last remaining apex predator in the Western and Eastern Cape.


It is an umbrella species and requires large areas of habitat and by conserving them many other animals are automatically conserved.


Less than 20% of South African landscapes are formally protected, this is not enough to ensure any species’ existence therefore conservation on private land is also needed.


Traditional predator control has had a significantly detrimental impact on biodiversity. The Cape fox and Riverine rabbit are rare and vulnerable to extinction. Lethal controls continue to impact on their populations.


Farmers are still battling with livestock losses even though predators have been gin-trapped, poisoned, hunted and killed for centuries in an effort to reduce their livestock losses. The problem of livestock losses is reportedly worse now than ever before, indicating these methods are ineffective.


The Cape lion became extinct in 1858 and the brown hyena and cheetah disappeared from most of the area in the 1900s. Due to their elusive nature and adaptability, leopard still fight for survival today. They have managed to remain in inhospitable and mountainous regions. As habitat diminishes and agriculture and game farming practices keep lethal controls in play, they, along with many other species, have little hope of survival and will soon face the same fate as the long extinct Cape lion. Private landowners are thus key in conserving these animals.
Other Ways You Can Help!
If you can't contribute monetarily, that doesn't me you can't help! Please share this campaign in any way possible. We are on Facebook and Twitter(@landmarkleopard), or you can visit our website (www.landmarkfoundation.org.za)

story:
Why Paperless Docket

Imagine if you save billions of papers printed every day simple my going paperless at the shopping registers.

This is the first of it's kind project in the world so become part of the history making.

Over vision is simple yet unique, to create a paperless checkout system where you simply scan a code at the checkout to create a digital version of your shopping docket for better record keeping, your receipts will never fade and above all create less waste.

  • My name is Raj and I am the founder of Buzzingaa - Australia'sForemost Location based Engagement Platform. Find out more at www.buzzingaa.com.au
  • Paperless Docket is an important campaign for me as I am very passionate about the amount of waste we create, in Australia alone over 8 billion shopping dockets are printed each year just to be trashed within 30 seconds. Our team is on a mission to change that globally.
  • Please support our vision by liking us on Facebook, spreading the word and contribute to our project by donating


What We Need & What You Get

  • We are seeking $25,000 funding for R&D to develop a patch for Major POS software where it will recognise our unique code and generate a digital version of shopping docket once this code is scanned..
  • By donating to our project, you can become the face of our Paperless Docket Campaign and be featured in our online and offline campaigns worldwide.
  • If we do not reach our goal of $25,000 we will invest the funds received into creating a public campaign tseeking major retailers to go paperless.

The Impact

Your donation will make a massive difference and could see our vision go global. This is the first of it's kind project in the world, so become part of the history making.

  • Save Millions of trees chopped down for paper and crate less unwanted waste.
  • Our team was the first in Australia to create a location based engagement platform called Buzzingaa. Find out more at www.buzzingaa.com.au. 
  • Buzzingaa has featured in the Australian Retailers Association Magazine and Shoe String Media for its unique concept.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • It's ok if you aren't able to contribute financially.
  • Please help us spread the word by sharing our vision with your friends and families. Like us on facebook.com/paperlessdocket and share.
  • Also  use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The world-reknowned Upper Jondachi River is threatened to be dammed by a poorly-conceived, government-run hydroelectricity project.  This river is part of one of the most pristine watersheds in Ecuador.  On top of this, it is a popular tourist destination, and is the crown jewel of local whitewater tourist offerings. 

To conduct a legal defense against the hydroproject, the Ecuadorian River Institute (ERI), 501c3, is seeking to raise $5,000 to match its current investment of $5,000 in this legal process (total legal fees are $10,000).

Protecting this river is an environmental, tourist and local business imperative, and we are grateful for your support!

 

Our Goal:

To defend the recreational and traditional uses and outstanding resource values of the Jondachi, with legal and technical arguments and the presentation of alternatives, through a due diligence legal process

 

Information on Proposed Hydroproject:

The government-owned thermal electricity company, CELEC EP - Termopichincha (Termopichincha), is developing the La Merced de Jondachi hydro project to offset a portion of its carbon emissions from its multiple fossil fuel power plants around the country. None of Termopichincha's thermal power plants are near the Jondachi.

The proposed, 18.1-MW, La Merced de Jondachi hydroelectric project has gross technical, economic and environmental deficiencies and lacks merit. It is a high cost, high risk project with very little benefit, which will eliminate a sustainable tourism economy.

 

Key Issues with the Proposed Hydroproject:

  • THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ELIMINATE WHITEWATER, TOURIST AND TRADITIONAL USES OF THE UPPER JONDACHI RIVER
  • Termopichincha has no previous experience developing hydroelectric projects and the project is poorly planned in every aspect
  • The hydroproject will have significant operational deficiencies because water flows in the river are lower than Termopichincha assumes
  • The cost of the project is disproportionately high to the amount of electricity it will generate
  • The proposed instream environmental flow is NOT sufficient to support the riparian ecosystem or allow for whitewater paddling
  • There are significantly better development alternatives for generating renewable energy

 

How You Can Help:

- Help us meet our fundraising goal for the legal process by September 20, 2013

- Learn more about the issues surrounding the project, by visiting our website:http://ecuadorianrivers.org/

- Come visit the Jondachi!

 

More Information:

  • Visit the ERI Website: http://ecuadorianrivers.org/
  • Video of the Upper Jondachi Rapids: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lqxjrMcordw
  • Get in touch! Write us for more information at info@ecuadorianrivers.org

 

Salvemos al Rio Jondachi!

 

About Us:

The ERI is incorporated in the state of Colorado as a US non-profit 501c3 organization, and works to protect and conserve unique watershed resources in Ecuador.

The ERI targets river drainages which are important for recreational river use and advocates protecting river corridors for the benefit of maintaining the high levels of biodiversity and realizing sustainable, tourism-based economies in these areas.

Years of exploring and documenting whitewater rivers in the Ecuadorian Andes and observing the significant and growing threats to watershed quality led to the formation of the Ecuadorian Rivers Institute in August, 2002.

 

Use of Indiegogo Funding:

The legal defense of the Jondachi River from the development of the La Merced de Jondachi Hydroelectric Project is estimated to be $10,000. The Ecuadorian Rivers Institute (ERI) has contributed $5,000 to review the case and initiate legal actions, and is raising an additional $5,000 to cover the full cost.  The legal strategy will use existing Ecuadorian laws and regulations to set a precedent for the consideration of recreational and traditional uses of water to protect the biodiversity and outstanding resource values of the Jondachi River.

The ERI has contracted a prominent Ecuadorian law firm to defend the integrity of the Jondachi River. The firm has supported the ERI with occasional pro bono legal services for several years and has demonstrated professional competence and results. However, the work load for this case exceeds their capacity to continue delivering services on a pro bono basis. They have quoted discounted rates to work with the ERI to review the case, present a legal demand for an extraordinary revision of the project permits and development, represent the ERI in legal hearings, and try to negotiate a successful settlement.

If we exceed our fundraising target, the ERI will use the funds for defenses of the Jondachi and other endangered local rivers.

story:
STOP TANKER TRAFFIC IN THE FRASER RIVER ESTUARY



The mighty Fraser River is one of the greatest salmon rivers in the world.  The Fraser River Estuary is also home to the globally significant migratory bird populations and the Reifel Migratory Bird Sanctuary.  The Fraser River Estuary has also been recognized for its globally important wetlands by the international Ramsar convention.

“The Ramsar Convention is an internationaltreatyfor the conservation and sustainable utilization ofwetlands, to stem the progressive encroachment on and loss of wetlands now and in the future, recognizing the fundamentalecologicalfunctions of wetlands and their economic, cultural, scientific, and recreational value.”

Caelie_Frampton

However, a recent project has been approved that will put the Fraser Estuary and the public’s safety at significant risk.  The Vancouver Fuel Facilities Corporation’s (VAFFC) development would result in a marine terminal located 15km upstream of its mouth on the Richmond side of South Arm of Fraser River. That facility would accommodate Panamax class fuel tankers load with toxic and flammable jet fuel to be unloaded into 80 million litre tank farm a short distance away, which would then be transported in a new pipeline15km across Richmond to the Vancouver Airport.  The marine terminal would be located 400 meters from a large residential and commercial entertainment complex, with potentially thousands of people in attendance at any given time.


VAFFC’s own documentation states that the spill frequency probability for this project is 6000 liters every 6 years and 120,000 liter spill every 32 years. There has been a lack of system safety analysis to determine if is possible to protect the community from the hazards this project poses and serious concerns from Richmond Fire Rescue confirms that in an accidental spill it will put the public and environment at an unacceptable risk.

Dead fish in jet fuel in Lemon Ck. BC

In response to this real threat to the river and the public, the VAPOR Society was formed. It is a group of volunteer citizens and professionals including former senior Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) biologist of 32 years and retired system safety engineer that worked on the Space Shuttle’s Canadarm.  VAPOR’s mandate opposes jet fuel tankers in the Fraser River and promotes better and safer options to get fuel to Vancouver Airport (YVR).  BC Environmental Office and Environment Minister have approved VAFFC’s proposal to put tankers in the Fraser River and our last resort is to now take legal action to protect the Fraser River from this unnecessary and irresponsible project.


VAPOR supports the economic importance of the airport and there are economically feasible options that are much more environmentally acceptable and overall better ways to get fuel to YVR airport. VAPOR insists that VAFFC re-visit the option they identified, that is to transport jet fuel to YVR by means of pipeline only from the two refineries that now supply 100% of the fuel needed at the airport, and then promptly dismissed its currently proposed option.

Your support will go toward legal action to force the re-assessment of this project and prevent the serious safety risks this project pose and to help protect the world class salmon/fisheries/migratory bird Fraser River Estuary and its associated sensitive habitats and sanctuaries.

story:
L’alta via più lunga del mondo: un sentiero sconosciuto di 6.880 km che attraversa tutte le montagne d'Italia. Una spedizione di un anno per rilanciare le terre alte. Tre ragazzi e un team inclusivo, di cui anche tu puoi far parte, per raccontare la vita tra le montagne italiane: un viaggio collettivo che inizia ora, grazie al tuo contributo.

 

L’ALTA VIA PIÙ LUNGA DEL MONDO ​

 

 

In Italia esiste un sentiero che attraversa tutte le catene montuose e abbraccia l’intero stivale, cavalcandone ininterrottamente la spina dorsale: dall’enrosadira delle Dolomiti ai crateri dell’Etna, dagli stambecchi del Gran Paradiso ai secolari pini loricati del Pollino... Tocca tutte le regioni e passa per centinaia di piccoli borghi montani, incontaminati, spesso sconosciuti, scrigni di antichi usi e costumi. Leggende, dialetti, ricette… un mosaico di infinite particolarità che rendono unico il Bel Paese.

Tutto questo è il Sentiero Italia.

Con i suoi 6.880 km, le sue 368 tappe e un dislivello positivo di 350.000 m, il Sentiero Italia è l’alta via più lunga del mondo... nel paese più bello del mondo!

E’ un autentico tesoro, un patrimonio mondiale. Ne hai mai sentito parlare? 

Ideato dall'Associazione Sentiero Italia nel 1983 e realizzato grazie all'intervento del Club Alpino Italiano, il Sentiero è stato a lungo dimenticato, come molte delle terre che esso attraversa.

Ma oggi il Sentiero è tornato alla luce: nel 2018 infatti il Club Alpino Italiano ha annunciato la sua riapertura! Negli ultimi mesi, centinaia di volontari CAI hanno lavorato duramente all’opera di restauro del percorso, che verrà ultimato entro questa primavera...

...e noi si parte!

 

 

LA NOSTRA MISSION

 

Siamo Yuri, Sara e Giacomo, tre ragazzi innamorati delle montagne, compagni di vita e di tante avventure. Amiamo il nostro paese e vogliamo meritarci le meraviglie che ci circondano, impegnandoci in prima persona a fare qualcosa di concreto.

Scoperta l’esistenza del Sentiero Italia, nel 2017, è nato in noi il desiderio intimo e personale di percorrerlo. Abbiamo subito compreso che questo viaggio sarebbe dovuto diventare un’esperienza coinvolgente, collettiva, aperta a tutti: un’occasione unica per fare qualcosa di concreto per le nostre montagne.

Il nostro obiettivo è contribuire a rilanciare il Sentiero Italia: vogliamo farlo conoscere in tutto il mondo e così facendo dare voce alle terre alte, luoghi meravigliosi ma spesso dimenticati, che da decenni subiscono il fenomeno dello spopolamento.

In che modo? Percorrendo a piedi tutto il Sentiero Italia insieme a chiunque vorrà unirsi alla nostra spedizione, raccontando in diretta questa avventura e raccogliendo la nostra esperienza in un portale web che sarà una finestra sulle terre alte italiane, multilingua e sempre a portata di smartphone. Per riuscirci però abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto: dona ora e cammina con noi!

Il nostro sogno è che questo progetto sia il seme per una svolta positiva per le montagne italiane.

“Non aspettarti nessuna risposta oltre la tua” - B. Brecht

 

 

 

COSA FAREMO

 

 

2019, Anno Nazionale del Turismo Lento.

Il viaggio avrà inizio a maggio. In cammino per oltre un anno, scopriremo di persona le 368 tappe del Sentiero Italia, da Nord a Sud, nell'unica maniera sostenibile: camminando.

Un viaggio lento e intenso: 6880 km di incontri e scoperte, attraverso i mille volti del nostro paese. Un’avventura unica, irripetibile, una scoperta di cui anche tu puoi far parte: potrai camminare insieme a noi, diventando voce narrante del Sentiero Italia!

Grazie ai social, giorno dopo giorno racconteremo la nostra esperienza e i luoghi attraversati: i paesaggi, le genti, i dialetti, i cibi, le tradizioni, i mestieri vecchi e nuovi… quanto basta a ingolosire i viaggiatori di tutto il mondo!

Durante la marcia documenteremo le unicità delle terre alte attraversate dal Sentiero Italia e inseriremo queste “pillole” su una piattaforma web realizzata ad hoc, a disposizione di tutti. Condivideremo inoltre le nostre tracce gps, complete delle info utili per affrontare il cammino (punti di accoglienza, luoghi di interesse, punti d’acqua, criticità…).

Daremo vita alla prima spedizione collettiva condivisa in tempo reale.

Esploratori di tutto il mondo, uniamoci!

 

 

 

PERCHÉ IL TUO CONTRIBUTO CONTA

 

Ora servono i fondi per trasformare questo sogno in realtà: la spedizione è tanto ambiziosa quanto… costosa!

Da buoni camminatori, facciamo un passo alla volta. E i primi passi li vogliamo fare proprio qui, con te. Il crowdfunding per noi è un modo del tutto naturale e coerente di far crescere Va’ Sentiero: un progetto che nasce dal basso, per valorizzare insieme un tesoro che appartiene a tutti noi.

Grazie al tenace lavoro degli ultimi due anni, abbiamo trovato gli sponsor (Montura, Ferrino e Ziel) che ci hanno fornito del materiale tecnico: zaini, abbigliamento, scarpe, tende, sacchi a pelo, binocoli…

Abbiamo consolidato importanti partnership: dal Touring Club Italiano a Radio Francigena, le Scuole ... Abbiamo ottenuto tantissimi patrocini: il Ministero dell’Ambiente, oltre 10 Regioni italiane e tante associazioni nazionali...

Grazie a questa fitta rete, abbiamo creato un’incredibile cassa di risonanza per il progetto.

Solo con il tuo aiuto potremo iniziare quest'avventura!

 

 

PERCHE' VA' SENTIERO E' UN PROGETTO SPECIALE?

 

 

 

 

COME UTILIZZEREMO I FONDI RACCOLTI

 

 

 

1. LA SPEDIZIONE

Con i primi 20.000 euro, copriremo i costi vivi del viaggio: le spese di vitto e alloggio dei primi 7 mesi di viaggio, per noi e per il team di supporto (responsabile logistica, comunicazione, driver). Inoltre ci procureremo le tecnologie di base a produrre i contenuti multimediali per raccontare i luoghi attraversati: attrezzatura fotografica, hard disk, un drone e dispositivi gps.

Daremo vita alla prima spedizione collettiva raccontata in tempo reale!

 

2. IL LIBRO: VOLTI DEL SENTIERO ITALIA

A viaggio concluso raccoglieremo in un libro i paesaggi del Sentiero Italia e i ritratti delle centinaia di persone che incontreremo e quelle che si uniranno a questa pazza spedizione, condividendo con noi la fatica e il sudore, ma anche la gioia e la passione: gli ambasciatori di Va’ Sentiero. Tra quelle pagine ci sarai anche tu!

La produzione del libro costerà circa 5.000 euro. Le fotografie saranno realizzate da Sara, la fotografa ufficiale di Va’ Sentiero e il volume sarà auto-prodotto. Sarà possibile acquistarlo online, ma intanto puoi essere tra i primi ad aggiudicarselo scegliendolo come ricompensa alla tua donazione!

 

3. I REPORTAGE VIDEO 

Durante la spedizione, vogliamo coinvolgere giovani professionisti del campo audio-visivo, per documentare questa irripetibile esperienza e produrre video di qualità che saranno condivisi sui social e sul sito.  Vogliamo presentare nel migliore dei modi le mille meraviglie custodite tra le montagne, dai paesaggi naturali a quelli umani: sarebbe un peccato usare solo gli smartphones!

Abbiamo già iniziato a creare una rete di giovani videomakers talentuosi e determinati a unirsi a quest'avventura, a rotazione: con ulteriori  15.000 euro possiamo coprire le spese vive di un piccolo team audio-visivo per la prima tranche della spedizione!

 

4. IL FURGONE 

Se raccoglieremo altri 15.000 euro, prepareremo un furgone che ci seguirà a fondovalle:sarà la nostra stazione di editing on the road, per elaborare e diffondere i contenuti multimediali.  Inoltre fungerà da supporto logistico, per trasportare attrezzatura di emergenza e permetterci di viaggiare più leggeri.

Grazie al tuo aiuto attrezzeremo il furgone con tutto il necessario (dalle postazioni di lavoro ai pannelli fotovoltaici sul tetto) e ne copriremo le spese di viaggio e manutenzione.

 

5. IL SITO

Se raccoglieremo altri 5.000 euro, creeremo una piattaforma web trasversale, implementata grazie al lavoro di ricerca svolto lungo il cammino: una finestra aperta sul nostro paese-montagna.

Sarà uno strumento interattivo, multilingua, mobile friendly. Al suo interno, troverai ii contenuti multimediali (foto e video) e gli approfondimenti sulle unicità locali: la biodiversità, le ricette, i dialetti, la musica, le feste, i borghi…

Caricheremo sul sito le nostre tracce gps (complete di info quali criticità, strutture ricettive, punti d'acqua), scaricabili gratuitamente. Infine, grazie alla condivisione della nostra posizione reale in homepage, potrai seguire gli sviluppi del nostro viaggio e sapere dove unirti alla spedizione,.


 

CAMMINARE CON NOI: COSA SIGNIFICA

 

Le singole tappe della spedizione e le rispettive tempistiche verranno pubblicate sui nostri canali social e sul nostro sito, con cadenza mensile.

Diventando nostro sostenitore, avrai in anteprima le tappe e le tempistiche: potrete scegliere la vostra tappa preferita e diventare parte della squadra di camminatori che ci accompagnerà in quel tratto.

Essere parte di una spedizione significa giocare in una squadra in cui ognuno ha un ruolo da svolgere, con responsabilità, per il successo dell’impresa. Ci sarà la squadra sherpa, che si occuperà della logistica; o quella dei topografi, addetti alla raccolta delle info tecniche; o ancora, quella dei reporters, che documenteranno i momenti e i luoghi…

E tu, di quale squadra vorrai far parte?

 

 

 

 

S.I. WE CAN

 

Sono le opportunità a entusiasmarci! Esse riguardo un valore trascurato, che può dare un contributo importante alle montagne e alle loro comunità.

Siamo consapevoli si tratti di un progetto impegnativo. La montagna stessa, d'altronde, è una strada in salita, ma siamo sicuri che, se camminerai insieme a noi, riusciremo ad arrivare in cima.

Del resto Walter Bonatti, cui questo progetto è dedicato, disse che “chi più in alto sale, più lontano vede”.

E noi proprio là puntiamo, in alto.

 

 

Ci vediamo sul Sentiero

& seguici sui social!

FB -  IG 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The longest mountain trail in the world: an unknown trail 6880 km long that crosses all the Italian mountains. A year long expedition to enhance the value of mountainous areas. Three friends and an inclusive team, which you can join, to tell about life in the Italian alpine communities. A collective journey that starts now, thanks to your contribution.  


 

 

THE HIGHEST MOUNTAIN TRAIL IN THE WORLD

 

In Italy there is a hiking trail that runs uninterruptedly across all the mountain ranges and ridges from North to South: from the Dolomites to Etna's craters, from the vertigos of the Matterhorn to the ancient pine trees of the Pollino. It touches all the regions and goes through hundreds of tiny alpine hamlets, often unknown, pristine, treasuring ancient traditions, legends, dialects, recipes...a mosaic  of endless peculiarities that make our country unique.

All this is the Sentiero Italia.

With its 6.880 km, its 368 stages and a total climb of 350.000 m +, the Sentiero Italia is the highest mountain trail in the world...in the most beautiful country in the world!

It is a real treasure, a world heritage, unfortunately still little known.

Created by the Associazione Sentiero Italia in 1983 and built thanks to the Club Alpino Italiano (CAI), the S.I. has been long forgotten: just like many of the lands it runs through.

But today the Sentiero is ready to be revamped: in 2018 the Club Alpino Italiano has announced its re-opening! Hundreds of volunteers are working to restore the path which will be completed this spring..

...and we go!

 

 

OUR MISSION

 

We are Yuri, Sara and Giacomo, three friends passionate about the mountains, sharing life and its many adventures. We love our country and we want to deserve the beauty that surrounds us by developing a grassroot concrete project.

After finding out about the Sentiero Italia, in 2017, we felt the urge to hike the trail. We soon realised that the journey should become a collective and inclusive experience, the occasion to do something concrete and beneficial for our mountains.

Our objective is to revamp the Sentiero Italia, make it popular across the world, hence giving a voice to the mountains, often forgotten but wonderful places which have been increasingly abandoned over the past decades.

How will we do it? We'll hike the Sentiero Italia in its entirety, together with all those who will want to join the expedition. We'll narrate our adventure in real time and we'll collect our findings in a dedicated website, as an open window to the Italian mountain world. It will be dynamic and multilingual. In order to make it, though, we need you your help. Support now & walk with us!

Our dream is for this project to be the seed for a positive change for the Italian mountains.

“Don't expect any answer other than your own” - B. Brecht


 

 

 

WHAT WE WILL DO

2019, National Year for Slow Tourism.

Our journey will begin in May. For a year and a half we will explore personally the 368 stages of the Sentiero Italia, from North to South, in the only sustainable way: walking.

A slow and intense journey: 6880 km of encounters and discovery, through the multiple facets of our country. A unique adventure, a discovery that you can join too: supporting us, hiking with us, becoming the voice of the Sentiero Italia!

Thanks to social media, we will post daily updates about our experience and the places we visit: landscapes, people, dialects, food, traditions, old and new trades...

We will create a collective expedition shared in real time. Travellers from all over the world, join us!

Moreover, during the hike we will gather the information necessary to hike the trail and we will add it to a customized web platform available and free to everyone. We will share the GPS tracks and useful tips about the path (accommodation and food, water sources,  places worth a visit...).

We will create the first collective expedition Italia shared in real time!

Explorers of the world, unite!

 

 

 

WHY YOUR CONTRIBUTION COUNTS

 

Now we need funds to transform this dream in reality: the expedition is as ambitious as...expensive!

As good hikers, we take one step at a time. And we want to take the first steps right here, with you. To us, crowdfunding is a natural and coherent way to grow Va’ Sentiero: a grassroot project aimed at enhancing together a treasure that belongs to us.

Thanks to the tireless work of the past two years, we found sponsors, (Montura, Ferrino e Ziel) who provide technical equipment: backpacks, clothing, shoes, tents, sleeping bags, sunglasses...

We have built important partnership with the Touring Club Italiano and Radio Francigena. We have achieved significant patronages such as the one with the Ministry of Environment, together with twelve Italian Regions.

Thanks to this great network, our project has developed quite a big fame!

Only with your help this expedition will be possible!

 

 

 

WHY IS VA' SENTIERO A SPECIAL PROJECT? 

 

 

HOW WILL WE USE THE FUNDS


 

1. THE EXPEDITION

With the first 20k euros, will cover the travel costs of the journey: food and accommodation for the first 8 months, for us and our team (logistics, communication, driver). We wil also get the technologies required to gather the information regarding the trail and provide insights into the hike: photo equipment, a drone, gps.

We will create the first collective expedition Italia shared in real time!

 

2. THE BOOK: IMPRESSIONS OF THE SENTIERO ITALIA

With 5k euros, at the end of the journey we plan to gather in a photo book all the landscapes from the Sentiero Italia and the portraits  of the hundreds of people who will join us, sharing the efforts and the sweat, but also the joy and the passion: the ambassadors of Va’ Sentiero. You could also be among those pages!

The photos will be taken by Sara, Va’ Sentiero's official photographer, and the book will be created thanks to the support of a graphic designer. It will be possible to buy it online, but you can be one of the first to receive it as a prize for your donation!

 

3. THE VIDEO REPORTAGE

Throughout the expedition, we would like to be joined by young professional video-makers, on a rota basis. That would allow us to build an archive of high quality visual material about the whole experience. Our wish is to accurately represent the uniqueness of the astonishing lands that we will be crossing. The videos will be shared on our website and social media.

Our network is growing: some talented and adventurous video-makers have already jumped on board. With an extra 15K euros we would be able to cover our audio-visual team’s expenses for the first part of the journey!

 

 

4. THE VAN

If we raise other 15k euros, we will customize a van which will follow us down in the valley,  in order to provide logistic support as well as a place to edit our media content on the road.

Thanks to your help we will equip the van (from work stations to solar panels on the roof) and we wil cover the trip expenses and maintenance.

 

5. THE WEBSITE

If we raise other 5k euros, we will create a multi-themed web platform that will act as a window on our mountains.

It will be an interactive tool, multilingual, mobile friendly. There, you wil find: media content (foto and video) and the insights into local life: the biodiversity, the recipes, the dialects, the music, the festivals, the hamlets…the necessary to make all travellers jealous and to promote these mountains!

We will also upload our gps tracks (with all the info such as difficulty, accommodation, water sources), free to download, comment and share.

Lastly, on the platform you will be able to follow our journey and plan when to join us thanks to our constant location sharing on our homepage.


 

 

WALKING WITH US: WHAT DOES IT MEAN
 

Single stages and timings will be published monthly on social media and our website.

By supporting us through the crowdfunding, you will receive the stages and related timings in advance: this means you will be able to choose you favourite stage and become part of the walking team for that stage! 

Taking part to an expedition involves team work, where everyone has a role to play and responsibilities in order to succeed. The team sherpa, will deal with logistics; the one of the surveyors, responsible for gathering technical information; and also the one of the reporters, who will document places and experiences…

...which team would like to join?

 

 

S.I. WE CAN

 

We love opportunities! To provide a great contribution to the mountains and their communities and bring back to life a disregarded Italian heritage.

We are aware this is an ambitious project. The mountain itself is an uphill road.

But Walter Bonatti, to whom we dedicate this project, said “those who climb the highest will see the furthest”.

And that's exactly where we are aiming to get to. High up there.

SEE YOU ON THE SENTIERO!

& Follow us on social media!

FB -  IG
story_txt:
L’alta via più lunga del mondo: un sentiero sconosciuto di 6.880 km che attraversa tutte le montagne d'Italia. Una spedizione di un anno per rilanciare le terre alte. Tre ragazzi e un team inclusivo, di cui anche tu puoi far parte, per raccontare la vita tra le montagne italiane: un viaggio collettivo che inizia ora, grazie al tuo contributo. L’ALTA VIA PIÙ LUNGA DEL MONDO ​  In Italia esiste un sentiero che attraversa tutte le catene montuose e abbraccia l’intero stivale, cavalcandone ininterrottamente la spina dorsale: dall’enrosadira delle Dolomiti ai crateri dell’Etna, dagli stambecchi del Gran Paradiso ai secolari pini loricati del Pollino... Tocca tutte le regioni e passa per centinaia di piccoli borghi montani, incontaminati, spesso sconosciuti, scrigni di antichi usi e costumi. Leggende, dialetti, ricette… un mosaico di infinite particolarità che rendono unico il Bel Paese.Tutto questo è il Sentiero Italia.Con i suoi 6.880 km, le sue 368 tappe e un dislivello positivo di 350.000 m, il Sentiero Italia è l’alta via più lunga del mondo... nel paese più bello del mondo!E’ un autentico tesoro, un patrimonio mondiale. Ne hai mai sentito parlare? Ideato dall'Associazione Sentiero Italia nel 1983 e realizzato grazie all'intervento del Club Alpino Italiano, il Sentiero è stato a lungo dimenticato, come molte delle terre che esso attraversa.Ma oggi il Sentiero è tornato alla luce: nel 2018 infatti il Club Alpino Italiano ha annunciato la sua riapertura! Negli ultimi mesi, centinaia di volontari CAI hanno lavorato duramente all’opera di restauro del percorso, che verrà ultimato entro questa primavera......e noi si parte!  LA NOSTRA MISSION Siamo Yuri, Sara e Giacomo, tre ragazzi innamorati delle montagne, compagni di vita e di tante avventure. Amiamo il nostro paese e vogliamo meritarci le meraviglie che ci circondano, impegnandoci in prima persona a fare qualcosa di concreto.Scoperta l’esistenza del Sentiero Italia, nel 2017, è nato in noi il desiderio intimo e personale di percorrerlo. Abbiamo subito compreso che questo viaggio sarebbe dovuto diventare un’esperienza coinvolgente, collettiva, aperta a tutti: un’occasione unica per fare qualcosa di concreto per le nostre montagne.Il nostro obiettivo è contribuire a rilanciare il Sentiero Italia: vogliamo farlo conoscere in tutto il mondo e così facendo dare voce alle terre alte, luoghi meravigliosi ma spesso dimenticati, che da decenni subiscono il fenomeno dello spopolamento.In che modo? Percorrendo a piedi tutto il Sentiero Italia insieme a chiunque vorrà unirsi alla nostra spedizione, raccontando in diretta questa avventura e raccogliendo la nostra esperienza in un portale web che sarà una finestra sulle terre alte italiane, multilingua e sempre a portata di smartphone. Per riuscirci però abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto: dona ora e cammina con noi!Il nostro sogno è che questo progetto sia il seme per una svolta positiva per le montagne italiane.“Non aspettarti nessuna risposta oltre la tua” - B. Brecht   COSA FAREMO  2019, Anno Nazionale del Turismo Lento.Il viaggio avrà inizio a maggio. In cammino per oltre un anno, scopriremo di persona le 368 tappe del Sentiero Italia, da Nord a Sud, nell'unica maniera sostenibile: camminando.Un viaggio lento e intenso: 6880 km di incontri e scoperte, attraverso i mille volti del nostro paese. Un’avventura unica, irripetibile, una scoperta di cui anche tu puoi far parte: potrai camminare insieme a noi, diventando voce narrante del Sentiero Italia!Grazie ai social, giorno dopo giorno racconteremo la nostra esperienza e i luoghi attraversati: i paesaggi, le genti, i dialetti, i cibi, le tradizioni, i mestieri vecchi e nuovi… quanto basta a ingolosire i viaggiatori di tutto il mondo!Durante la marcia documenteremo le unicità delle terre alte attraversate dal Sentiero Italia e inseriremo queste “pillole” su una piattaforma web realizzata ad hoc, a disposizione di tutti. Condivideremo inoltre le nostre tracce gps, complete delle info utili per affrontare il cammino (punti di accoglienza, luoghi di interesse, punti d’acqua, criticità…).Daremo vita alla prima spedizione collettiva condivisa in tempo reale.Esploratori di tutto il mondo, uniamoci!   PERCHÉ IL TUO CONTRIBUTO CONTA Ora servono i fondi per trasformare questo sogno in realtà: la spedizione è tanto ambiziosa quanto… costosa!Da buoni camminatori, facciamo un passo alla volta. E i primi passi li vogliamo fare proprio qui, con te. Il crowdfunding per noi è un modo del tutto naturale e coerente di far crescere Va’ Sentiero: un progetto che nasce dal basso, per valorizzare insieme un tesoro che appartiene a tutti noi.Grazie al tenace lavoro degli ultimi due anni, abbiamo trovato gli sponsor (Montura, Ferrino e Ziel) che ci hanno fornito del materiale tecnico: zaini, abbigliamento, scarpe, tende, sacchi a pelo, binocoli…Abbiamo consolidato importanti partnership: dal Touring Club Italiano a Radio Francigena, le Scuole ... Abbiamo ottenuto tantissimi patrocini: il Ministero dell’Ambiente, oltre 10 Regioni italiane e tante associazioni nazionali...Grazie a questa fitta rete, abbiamo creato un’incredibile cassa di risonanza per il progetto.Solo con il tuo aiuto potremo iniziare quest'avventura!  PERCHE' VA' SENTIERO E' UN PROGETTO SPECIALE?    COME UTILIZZEREMO I FONDI RACCOLTI   1. LA SPEDIZIONECon i primi 20.000 euro, copriremo i costi vivi del viaggio: le spese di vitto e alloggio dei primi 7 mesi di viaggio, per noi e per il team di supporto (responsabile logistica, comunicazione, driver). Inoltre ci procureremo le tecnologie di base a produrre i contenuti multimediali per raccontare i luoghi attraversati: attrezzatura fotografica, hard disk, un drone e dispositivi gps.Daremo vita alla prima spedizione collettiva raccontata in tempo reale! 2. IL LIBRO: VOLTI DEL SENTIERO ITALIAA viaggio concluso raccoglieremo in un libro i paesaggi del Sentiero Italia e i ritratti delle centinaia di persone che incontreremo e quelle che si uniranno a questa pazza spedizione, condividendo con noi la fatica e il sudore, ma anche la gioia e la passione: gli ambasciatori di Va’ Sentiero. Tra quelle pagine ci sarai anche tu!La produzione del libro costerà circa 5.000 euro. Le fotografie saranno realizzate da Sara, la fotografa ufficiale di Va’ Sentiero e il volume sarà auto-prodotto. Sarà possibile acquistarlo online, ma intanto puoi essere tra i primi ad aggiudicarselo scegliendolo come ricompensa alla tua donazione! 3. I REPORTAGE VIDEO Durante la spedizione, vogliamo coinvolgere giovani professionisti del campo audio-visivo, per documentare questa irripetibile esperienza e produrre video di qualità che saranno condivisi sui social e sul sito.  Vogliamo presentare nel migliore dei modi le mille meraviglie custodite tra le montagne, dai paesaggi naturali a quelli umani: sarebbe un peccato usare solo gli smartphones!Abbiamo già iniziato a creare una rete di giovani videomakers talentuosi e determinati a unirsi a quest'avventura, a rotazione: con ulteriori  15.000 euro possiamo coprire le spese vive di un piccolo team audio-visivo per la prima tranche della spedizione! 4. IL FURGONE Se raccoglieremo altri 15.000 euro, prepareremo un furgone che ci seguirà a fondovalle:sarà la nostra stazione di editing on the road, per elaborare e diffondere i contenuti multimediali.  Inoltre fungerà da supporto logistico, per trasportare attrezzatura di emergenza e permetterci di viaggiare più leggeri.Grazie al tuo aiuto attrezzeremo il furgone con tutto il necessario (dalle postazioni di lavoro ai pannelli fotovoltaici sul tetto) e ne copriremo le spese di viaggio e manutenzione. 5. IL SITOSe raccoglieremo altri 5.000 euro, creeremo una piattaforma web trasversale, implementata grazie al lavoro di ricerca svolto lungo il cammino: una finestra aperta sul nostro paese-montagna.Sarà uno strumento interattivo, multilingua, mobile friendly. Al suo interno, troverai ii contenuti multimediali (foto e video) e gli approfondimenti sulle unicità locali: la biodiversità, le ricette, i dialetti, la musica, le feste, i borghi…Caricheremo sul sito le nostre tracce gps (complete di info quali criticità, strutture ricettive, punti d'acqua), scaricabili gratuitamente. Infine, grazie alla condivisione della nostra posizione reale in homepage, potrai seguire gli sviluppi del nostro viaggio e sapere dove unirti alla spedizione,. CAMMINARE CON NOI: COSA SIGNIFICA Le singole tappe della spedizione e le rispettive tempistiche verranno pubblicate sui nostri canali social e sul nostro sito, con cadenza mensile.Diventando nostro sostenitore, avrai in anteprima le tappe e le tempistiche: potrete scegliere la vostra tappa preferita e diventare parte della squadra di camminatori che ci accompagnerà in quel tratto.Essere parte di una spedizione significa giocare in una squadra in cui ognuno ha un ruolo da svolgere, con responsabilità, per il successo dell’impresa. Ci sarà la squadra sherpa, che si occuperà della logistica; o quella dei topografi, addetti alla raccolta delle info tecniche; o ancora, quella dei reporters, che documenteranno i momenti e i luoghi…E tu, di quale squadra vorrai far parte?    S.I. WE CAN Sono le opportunità a entusiasmarci! Esse riguardo un valore trascurato, che può dare un contributo importante alle montagne e alle loro comunità.Siamo consapevoli si tratti di un progetto impegnativo. La montagna stessa, d'altronde, è una strada in salita, ma siamo sicuri che, se camminerai insieme a noi, riusciremo ad arrivare in cima.Del resto Walter Bonatti, cui questo progetto è dedicato, disse che “chi più in alto sale, più lontano vede”.E noi proprio là puntiamo, in alto.  Ci vediamo sul Sentiero& seguici sui social!

story:
JULY 1, 2019 UPDATE: NEW STRETCH GOAL $10,000 to Raise $35,000

To Care For Our New Yulin Dog Meat Survivors

The No Dogs Left Behind team has been working tirelessly around the clock during the Yulin Dog Meat Festival (6/21-6/30). Now, the newly-rescued dogs in the care of No Dogs Left Behind are in need of vaccinations, medicine, treatment, and lots of tender loving care for the wounds and abuse that they have endured.  


HELP US to rehabilitate these Yulin Survivors so that they can go on to have happy, healthy lives in new forever loving homes. When our dogs walk the streets of the U.S. or Canada, they send a message to everyone who sees them.  They are the proud survivors and ambassadors of the work that No Dogs Left Behind (NDLB) does.

 

OUR NEW STRETCH GOAL Is To Raise $10,000 To Care For Our New Rescues!

Your contributions will cover the cost of emergency response, vaccinations, flea and tick medication and crucial medical treatment and continued care of our Yulin Survivors. 


 



No Dogs Left Behind is a non-governmental, non-profit organization and we rely solely on the donations of people such as yourself.  We couldn’t do our work without the kindness and generosity of caring people all over the world who support our cause.

THANK YOU for supporting the work of No Dogs Left Behind!

 

JUNE 30, 2019 UPDATE

Today is the last day of the dreaded Yulin Dog Meat Festival. We need to make room in our Beijing shelter for the dogs we have rescued from Yulin.  They desperately need vaccinations, medicine, treatment for wounds and much, much love. We are so grateful for ALL the support that we have received so far and continue to receive. We have raised $25,123 to date! Many of the dogs featured on this campaign will soon be making their flights to freedom. Stay tuned for more updates! 

 

JUNE 21 , 2019 UPDATE

We are so OVERWHELMED and GRATEFUL for ALL the support we've gotten!

Now that we have raised $15,000, we can bring the 10 dog meat survivors featured on this campaign safely to loving homes. But let's not stop here.  

HELP Us to raise MORE to bring home MORE Dog Meat Survivors

We're adding 3 more dogs to this campaign. Meet Yulin Dog Meat Survivors: Dude, Panda and Petunia. All 3 were rescued from a 6.19.17 dog meat truck headed for the Yulin Dog Meat Festival and you can help us get them safely to forever loving homes!

Dude

Panda

Petunia

 

We started this campaign to raise $15,000 to bring home 10 dogs, Some have asked why only 10 dogs. If you take a look at the adoption and transportation fees listed on our website you'll see why.

We wanted to start by raising enough money for 10 dogs first. If we raise more money we can bring EVEN MORE dogs home.  Let's keep it going!

 

OVERVIEW

No Dogs Left Behind (NDLB) is an organization dedicated to ending the dog meat trade by shutting down slaughterhouses, exposing the butchers, educating the general public about the humane treatment of dogs and working with government officials throughout the world to put laws into place to stop the brutal and barbaric treatment of dogs by humans.

Much of the dog meat trade takes place in countries in Asia. We believe that there are no borders in the fight to end the dog meat trade. We have chosen to focus on fighting to end the dog meat trade in China because that’s where the greatest number of dogs in the world  are being brutalized. Every year about 20 million dogs are brutally slaughtered in China. It is a 365-days-a-year fight.

Soon our fight will take on more urgency with the annual Yulin Dog Meat Festival right around the corner. Every June, 10,000-15,000 dogs are butchered, eaten, and skinned to make fur trims. We will be on high alert at this time in order to rescue more dogs. The shocking thing is that the majority of these dogs being tortured and eaten were once someone’s house pet and were stolen from their homes or sold to the butchers by their owners.

Currently we have 180 dogs in our shelter in Beijing - all rescued from dog meat trucks and slaughterhouses. But we need to make room for more of the dogs that will be rescued from Yulin.

Our current goal is to bring 10 dogs safely back to a forever loving home. In order to bring home 10 dogs, we will need to raise $15,000. This will cover the cost of their care, and of flying and transporting the dogs from China to the U.S.  If we can raise even more, we can bring back more dogs.  But these 10 are the most urgent.

Watch this video to learn more about the work that  No Dogs Left Behind (NDLB) does:

 

How Do The Chinese Feel About Eating Dogs?

Although the Yulin Dog Meat Festival began in 2009, the custom of eating dogs can be traced back to approximately 400 years ago.  There is a great article by the World Dog Alliance that goes into more detail about the Chinese culture and the history, both political and cultural, of eating dogs. Attitudes about dogs are changing in China amongst the middle class and there are now over 62 million registered pets in China.  Animal activists and pet lovers have begun to speak up and take more action against the brutal treatment of these animals.

 

OUR STORY

Back in 2016, Jeffrey Beri, had just come off a historic rescue mission in China.  He and other activists were successfully treating, rehabilitating and transporting 121 dogs from Yulin with funding provided by the Soi Dog Foundation. They had transport sponsorship for 11 dogs provided by the American Humane Society.  It took Jeff and his team months upon months of constant treatment and rehabilitation for these dogs to get well and learn to love.

After the 2016 rescue, Jeffrey went back to China and continued working with activists.  He brought 50 more dog meat trade dogs to safety that were in desperate need of help. 

 

OUR MISSION

No Dogs Left Behind (NDLB) has two missions of equal importance: end the dog meat trade completely and permanently; and, until we accomplish that goal, rescue as many dogs as possible, rehabilitating them and finding them forever homes.

Our entire organization operates on the Five Pillars of Rescue which Jeff Beri developed:

Emergency Response – brave activists track and then intercept dog meat trucks and stop the drivers from taking the dogs to the slaughterhouse.  No Dogs Left Behind and its team members provides emergency medical treatment to the dogs, all of whom are sick, beaten or starving (or all three).

Shelter Operations Protocol – Once the dogs are stabilized, they are brought back to our shelter to continue medical treatment, be vaccinated and spayed/neutered, and rehabilitated emotionally and psychologically.

Adoption – Our goal is to have our dogs adopted into loving homes. The adoption process is costly.  It is expensive to pay for the dogs’ transport and we must find a “flight hero” willing to travel to Beijing and return to the U.S. or Canada with the dogs.

Education– Educating the youth in China is a huge part of our operation. Teaching children to love and respect animals is what will ultimately bring an end to the brutal treatment of these dogs.

Government Advocacy – Quite possibly the most important step is getting the sale and consumption of dog meat outlawed. As impossible as this may seem, increasing numbers of Chinese support ending the dog meat trade.  While pressure from outside of China is important, we can only achieve our goal with the support of the Chinese people themselves.

 

THE IMPACT

Despite being bitten more times than he can count, Jeff works patiently and tirelessly with the dogs at our shelter while they recover and learn to trust humans again. When they are sent to their new homes, our dogs are our global ambassadors.  Their behavior in their new homes speaks louder than any words. When our dogs walk the streets of the U.S. or Canada, they send a message to everyone who sees them.  They are survivors and ambassadors of the work that No Dogs Left Behind (NDLB) does. The dogs don’t realize just how special they really are but we do.

 

MEET THE DOGS WE ARE PLANNING TO BRING HOME TO THE U.S.

Connor

Max

Nana

Panda

Petunia

 

UPDATE ON: PANDA & PETUNIA 

Panda and Petunia are now safely in the U.S. with loving families. Yulin Dog Meat Survivors Panda and Petunia were rescued from a 6.19.17 dog meat truck headed for the Yulin Dog Meat Festival. 

 

UPDATE: DUDE, JORDAN & WILLY Are Looking For Foster Homes Or To Be Adopted!

Dude, Jordan and Willy were all rescued by brave Chinese activists from the historic 6.19.17 dog meat truck interception with 1300 other dogs headed to the Yulin Dog Meat Festival. They will be taking their flights to freedom soon but still need to find forever loving homes. 

Dude was tortured and abused by the butchers. He is timid with strangers and needs a home with patient and extra love. He is playful and gets along well with other dogs. He loves treat and once he accepts you he will be your best loyal friend.

To Adopt Dude Visit: http://bit.ly/NDLB_Dude

 

Jordan is happy and playful, and  loves people and attention.

To Adopt Jordan Visit: http://bit.ly/NDLB-Jordan

 

Willy a playful, active, healthy, happy boy! Let's find him a forever loving home.

To Adopt Willy Visit: http://bit.ly/NDLB-WILLY

 

UPDATE: Jubilee's Been Adopted!

 

UPDATE: Chippy's Been Adopted!

 

UPDATE: NIkki  Is Looking For A Forever Loving Home

Nikki is 1 of the Yulin Dog Meat Survivors featured on our crowdfunding campaign. She will be taking her flight to freedom soon but still needs to find a forever loving home. 

When she was rescued by brave activists on 6.19.17, she was cramped tightly in horrific conditions in a dog meat truck, heading for the Yulin Dog Meat Festival, where thousands of dogs are tortured, cooked and eaten each year. Her face was smashed by the butchers and her body was covered in trauma wounds. No Dogs Left Behind treated Nikki’s wounds, administered rabies and distemper vaccinations, de-wormer, and flea and tick medications. With loving care NDLG and rehabilitated Nikki. 

Nikki is a sweet girl. Playful and perfect for a family home. Please help us find that home for Nikki!

To ADOPT NIKKI Visit: www..nodogsleftbehind.com/adopt

 

UPDATES: These Dogs Are Going To Loving Homes!

THANKS To ALL of Our Crowdfunding Supporters, Huski, Rocky and Sky, 3 of the dogs featured on our Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign, who also happen to be 11/29 slaughterhouse shutdown survivors are going to loving homes. 

To Learn more about the 11/29 slaughterhouse shutdown, WATCH this YouTube video: 

 

They are the lucky ones who made it out alive that day. When rescuers arrived some of the dogs had already been slaughtered. These dogs that were still alive and among the terrified witnesses to what the saw. But No Dogs Left Behind took these dogs in and treated and vaccinated them. And now they are proud slaughterhouse survivors.

 

UPDATES: These Dogs Have Been Adopted!

Kelly

Freddie

We Are Looking For Volunteers to Help Transport These Dogs From China to the U.S.

If you’re interested in volunteering to tag a dog onto your flight back to the U.S. contact us at: (917) 767-0134

 

The No Dogs Left Behind Team

Jeffrey Beri, Founder

Jeffrey Beri is the founder of No Dogs Left Behind (NDLB). Before founding NDLB, Jeffrey was a designer and manufacturer of high end jewelry. A life-long dog lover, one day Jeffrey took a trip to China to rescue dogs from the dog meat trade. What he saw affected him so much that he quit his job, sold his possessions and moved to China to devote himself to save dogs from the dog meat trade. In China, Jeffrey developed the Five Pillars of Rescue which sets the standard for rescuing and rehabilitating Dog Meat Trade survivors. He founded the No Dogs Left Behind (NDLB) Shelter in Beijing, the only Chinese shelter which engages in rescue, medical treatment, and rehabilitation of these beautiful but traumatized dogs. No Dogs Left Behind means exactly that. Every dog is treated, vetted, rehabilitated and set up for success to be adopted into forever loving homes 

Jeff works with activists to intercept dog meat trucks,  shut down slaughterhouses and engage in emergency evacuations of dogs. He and the shelter staff spend weeks, months, however long is necessary, to make them ready for their forever loving homes in the United States and Canada. Jeffrey is a firm believer that change in China will come from within. That is why he spends so much time at the shelter working with students of all ages, teaching them that dogs are animals to be loved and cherished, not killed and eaten. 

 

Bonnie Klapper, Legal Counsel

Bonnie Klapper is legal counsel and jack of all trades for No Dogs Left Behind. She has spent 33 years working in the criminal justice system as a federal prosecutor and a defense attorney.  Bonnie is a vegan and loves all animals but especially dogs. Now she works for a different form of justice - justice for the kidnapped, abused, tortured dogs of China. For Bonnie there is no higher calling than to save these dogs and work to change Chinese laws to end the meat trade. She is thankful to her parents for giving her the best legal education possible which has allowed her to devote herself to this most important cause. 

Here's an important message from Bonnie about the urgency surrounding the Yulin Dog Meat Festival: 

 

Press and Media Coverage

Wink News Video (Feb 2018)

ABC News Coverage of the 12/18/18 transport of 10 dogs to Chicago O’Hare

 

Recognition

2018 Pet Philanthropy Circle Pet Hero Awards

 

CAN'T DONATE? YOU CAN HELP BY SIMPLY RAISING AWARENESS

We understand that not everyone can donate or adopt a dog. But everyone, adults and children, can make a difference.  Help us raise awareness by using the hashtag: #nodogsleftbehind and sharing a link to this campaign.  Tell your friends and family about our work.  Sign petitions. Put up posters at your school.  Hold bake sales to raise money and spread the word.

 

All of us at No Dogs Left Behind (NDLB) thank you for your support!

 

LAST WORDS...

We are No Dogs Left Behind (NDLB).  That is our name and our mantra. We fight this war on all fronts – education, politically, financially, and culturally.  Through this strategy, we will end the meat trade.  Our voices will get louder and louder because we speak for the voiceless.  We will never stop until the dog meat trade is ended forever. 

 

LEARN MORE ABOUT No Dogs Left Behind (NDLB):

www.NoDogsLeftBehind.com

www.instagram.com/NoDogsLeftBehind

www.facebook.com/NoDogsLeftBehind

www.twitter.com/NDogsLB

www.pinterest.com/NoDogsLeftBehind
